0.title: 19-yr-old girl killed in leopard attack in Pune; 2nd incident in 2 months
0.article_body: A 19-year-old girl died after she was attacked by a leopard in Pune's Shirur taluka on Wednesday, officials said. The victim was in the front yard of her house when the leopard attacked her from behind and dragged her into nearby sugarcane cultivation, police said. This is the second such incident in the area over the last two months.

1.title: There is a lot to learn from India: IMF on India's social welfare programmes
1.article_body: Calling India's deployment of a direct cash transfer scheme and other similar social welfare programmes a "logistical marvel", the IMF said, "From India, there is a lot to learn." Paolo Mauro, Deputy Director of the Fiscal Affairs Department at IMF, said these programmes that seek to help people who are at low-income levels "reach literally hundreds of millions of people".

2.title: Edtech startup FrontRow fires 75% staff; 2nd round of layoffs in 5 months
2.article_body: Bengaluru-based edtech startup FrontRow has fired 75% of its workforce, around 130 employees, and is now left with a 45-member team. This is the second round of layoffs at the company in five months as it fired 30% of employees in May. The startup counts Deepika Padukone's Family Office, Lightspeed Venture Partners and Unacademy's Gaurav Munjal among its investors.

3.title: Waterlogging spots in Pune increased from 80 to 138: PMC survey
3.article_body: The number of waterlogging spots in Pune increased from 80 last year to 138 this year, showed a survey by Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC). In contrast to the past when such spots were mostly located near slums or low-lying areas, a majority of them have been identified near housing societies this time.

4.title: NGT imposes ₹900 cr fine on Delhi over unprocessed waste at 3 landfills
4.article_body: National Green Tribunal (NGT) imposed an environmental compensation amount of ₹900 crore on Delhi government over unprocessed waste at three landfills. The quantity of undisposed waste at the landfills is three crore tonnes, as per NGT's order. The deposit is to be made within one month and the deposit will be the responsibility of the Chief Secretary, NGT said.

5.title: India abstains from UN vote on Russia's illegal annexation of Ukrainian regions
5.article_body: India abstained from voting in the UN General Assembly on a draft resolution that condemned Russia's "illegal so-called referendums" and annexation of the Donetsk, Kherson, Luhansk and Zaporizhzhia regions of Ukraine. A total of 143 members voted in favour of the resolution while five voted against it. As many as 35 members abstained from the resolution.

6.title: Video shows moment when 100-kg tyre falls off cargo plane after takeoff in Italy
6.article_body: A video has captured the moment when a 100-kg wheel fell off a Boeing 747 Dreamlifter operated by Atlas Air, right after takeoff from Taranto in Italy. A black trail of smoke could be seen coming from where the tyre snapped. The aircraft, which is mainly used for transporting Boeing 787 Dreamliner components, later landed safely in the US.

7.title: Water supply in most parts of B'luru to be disrupted on Oct 14, 15
7.article_body: Water supply in most areas of Bengaluru will be disrupted on October 14 and 15 due to maintenance work at Cauvery Water Supply Scheme Stage 1 and 2 pump houses at TK Halli, Harohalli and Tataguni. Affected areas include NTY Layout, Telecom Layout, Kasturba Nagar and Lakkasandra. Vivekananda Nagar, Chamarajpet and Kaveri Layout, among others, will also be affected.

8.title: Mumbai University students get old paper in exam due to 'technical glitch'
8.article_body: The students of various colleges associated with the University of Mumbai were offered a previous year's question paper on Wednesday, as they appeared for their second-semester exams. Mumbai University’s official spokesperson for the examination section, Vinod, claimed that it was a "technical glitch". A fresh question paper was given an hour later, the students said.

9.title: Pune college clerk cheats woman of ₹6 lakh on promise of govt job
9.article_body: Police have booked a clerk of Pune-based College of Military Engineering for allegedly cheating a woman of around ₹6 lakh on the pretext of offering her a government job in the Indian Railways in 2019. The complainant runs a canteen at INS Shivaji, where the accused was earlier posted. The complainant was shown an appointment letter while being cheated.

10.title: Gang of women thieves targeting female commuters on Delhi Metro held
10.article_body: A gang of women thieves, who used to target women commuters in the Delhi Metro, have been arrested by the Metro Police, officials said. Based on a man's complaint, police scanned CCTV footage and got clues about one of the accused. The accused confessed during questioning, following which three of her accomplices were also arrested.

11.title: 20-yr-old Mumbai boy pulls girl's dupatta with 'sexual intent'; jailed
11.article_body: A special court in Mumbai has sentenced a 20-year-old boy to three-year jail for pulling a "dupatta" (stole) of a school-going girl with "sexual intent". The victim was going to a shop when the boy pulled her dupatta and held her hand. The judge said, "[Such]...incident causes terror in...mind of people, victim and her family...and leave scar for longer time."

12.title: Delhi's landfill sites went down by 462% in just 4 months: LG office
12.article_body: Disposal of legacy waste from Delhi's landfill sites between June-September 2022 increased by 462% as compared to preceding three years, Delhi Lieutenant Governor's office said. Legacy waste at Ghazipur, Bhalswa and Okhla dropped from 229.1 lakh million tonnes (mt) in May to 203 lakh mt in September. Legacy waste at the three sites was 280 lakh mt in mid-2019.

13.title: Delhi govt increases minimum wages, new rates applicable from Oct 1
13.article_body: The Delhi government has increased the minimum wages and the new rates will be applicable from October 1, officials said on Wednesday. "Amidst the rising inflation, this is a big step taken in the interest of the labour class," said Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, adding that Delhi has the highest minimum wages in comparison with other states.

14.title: Man hacks Mumbai Police officer's account, clears 3 passport applications
14.article_body: An unidentified person got access to the login ID and password of a Mumbai Police officer in the passport branch and cleared three applications pending verification, an official said on Wednesday. An FIR was registered against the accused for hacking into the online passport verification system managed by the Central government, he said.

15.title: 14 arrested members of PFI file plea in Delhi HC seeking compensation
15.article_body: As many as 14 arrested members of the Popular Front of India (PFI) approached the Delhi HC on Wednesday seeking their release and compensation, claiming that they were unlawfully detained. The petitioners claimed they were arrested from their homes on September 27 and weren't provided any reasons. The Centre has banned PFI and its associate outfits for five years.

16.title: India players celebrate Hardik Pandya's birthday in a small plane, Karthik shares video
16.article_body: Several Team India players including Dinesh Karthik, Rohit Sharma and Deepak Hooda celebrated all-rounder Hardik Pandya's birthday in a small plane in Australia. Sharing a video, Karthik wrote, "Celebrating birthdays on ground was too mainstream so we took it to the sky." In the video, Pandya can be seen sitting with the pilot apparently ahead of the take-off.

17.title: 5 men hack 19-year-old auto driver to death over old rivalry in Pune
17.article_body: Five men reportedly hacked a 19-year-old autorickshaw driver to death over an old rivalry in Pimpri Chinchwad on Monday evening. According to police, the deceased was driving the autorickshaw towards Rohkal when the passenger inside the auto started attacking him with a sharp weapon. Shortly, four other men in a car blocked the autorickshaw's way and attacked the driver.

18.title: Who are the top 5 batters as per latest T20I rankings?
18.article_body: New Zealand wicketkeeper-batter Devon Conway leapfrogged Australia's Aaron Finch and England's Dawid Malan to make it to fifth spot with 760 rating points in latest T20I rankings for batters. The rankings are led by Pakistan's Muhammad Rizwan (853 rating points). He's followed by India's Suryakumar Yadav (838) and Pakistan captain Babar Azam (808 points). South Africa's Aiden Markram is fourth.

19.title: Moonlighting a question of ethics, not legalities: Wipro CEO
19.article_body: On being asked whether moonlighting is legal or illegal, Wipro CEO Thierry Delaporte said, "It isn't a question of legalities, it's a question of ethics." He added, "We don't believe that it is right to have two jobs having a conflict of interest." He further said, "If other companies have no problem with that, we respect that."

20.title: India-UK FTA on 'verge of collapse' over visa comments: Report
20.article_body: After UK Home Secretary Suella Braverman questioned action over Indians overstaying their visa, the Free Trade Agreement between the two countries is on the verge of collapse, according to a UK media report. It stated that ministers of the Indian government were "shocked and dismayed" by Braverman's comments. Braverman called Indians the "largest group of people who overstay" their visas.

21.title: Ambati Rayudu, Sheldon Jackson involved in fight during match, video goes viral
21.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Baroda's Ambati Rayudu and Saurashtra's Sheldon Jackson getting involved in a fight during their Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy match. According to the on-air commentator, the fight ensued after Rayudu expressed his displeasure at Jackson taking time to get ready to face the deliveries. The umpires and players had to intervene to end their fight.

22.title: Nurse killed 5-day old baby by injecting air into his stomach, UK court told
22.article_body: A nurse allegedly killed a five-day-old baby by injecting air into his stomach through a nose tube, a UK court heard. Lucy Letby is accused of murdering seven babies and attempting to murder another ten between June 2015 and June 2016 at Countess of Chester hospital. She also allegedly sent a sympathy card to one of her victim's parents.

23.title: Passenger inserts 1066-g gold in rectum, arrested at Kochi airport
23.article_body: Air Intelligence Unit intercepted a passenger at Kerala's Kochi airport on Wednesday for allegedly trying to smuggle gold. The man had inserted four capsule-shaped packets containing 1066.75 g of gold into his rectum. He had travelled on an IndiGo flight from Doha in Qatar. This comes on the same day officials seized 3.8 kg of smuggled gold at Calicut airport.

24.title: Ayodhya verdict doesn't cover Places of Worship Act: SG tells SC
24.article_body: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta told the Supreme Court that the 2019 Ayodhya case verdict given by a five-judge Constitution bench does not deal with the validity of the Places of Worship Act, 1991. The Act protects character of religious places as it was on August 15, 1947. Petitions have been filed against the Act, calling the cut-off date "arbitrary".

25.title: Outsiders should not be allowed to cast their vote in J&K: Azad
25.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Ghulam Nabi Azad on Wednesday said that outsiders should not be allowed to cast their vote in the Union Territory. "The importance of voting in Jammu and Kashmir has been that only locals vote," Azad said. His comment comes after administration's order facilitating people residing for over one year in Jammu to register as voters.

26.title: NHAI's InvIT raises funds to finance 3 additional road projects
26.article_body: National Highways Infra Trust has raised ₹1,430 crore through the placement of its units for part funding its acquisition of three additional road projects from NHAI. According to official statement, investors include Canada Pension Plan Investment Board, SBI and TATA AIG, among other investors. Units were subscribed at a premium of ₹109 over the floor price of ₹107.12.

27.title: India's national record-holding discus thrower Kamalpreet banned for 3 years for doping
27.article_body: Kamalpreet Kaur, who holds national record in women's discus throw, has been banned for three years for doping. The Athletics Integrity Unit stated that Kaur tested positive for a banned substance [stanozolol] in a test conducted on March 7 this year. Her period of ineligibility started from March 29 and all her results since March 7 stand null and void.

28.title: Ben Stokes' flying effort at boundary rope to save six goes viral
28.article_body: A video has gone viral showing England all-rounder Ben Stokes' acrobatic effort to save a shot from Australia's Mitchell Marsh from going for a six at long-off during the second T20I in Canberra. Reacting to the video, a fan tweeted, "How he did that so brilliantly!" Another fan wrote, "Unbelievable athleticism!" "His reaction time is outstanding," another tweet read.

29.title: Ola, Uber and Rapido-run autos continue services despite ban in Karnataka
29.article_body: Online booking of auto-rickshaw services continued to be available on ride-hailing platforms such as Uber, Ola and Rapido, despite Karnataka government making such services illegal from Wednesday. However, the number of auto-rickshaws using these platforms seemed to have come down as the waiting time in some places in Bengaluru went up. The move came following multiple complaints of overcharging.

30.title: Shah to inaugurate 'Gujarat Gaurav Yatra' in Ahmedabad on Thursday
30.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah will inaugurate the 'Gujarat Gaurav Yatra' in Ahmedabad on Thursday. Shah is scheduled to visit Sant Shree Savaiyanath temple to pay obeisance in Ahmedabad's Zanzarka and later visit Unai Mata Temple to offer prayers in Navsari district's Unai on Thursday. Earlier on Wednesday, BJP chief JP Nadda flagged off the yatra in Mahesana.

31.title: Thirdhand smoke can trigger skin diseases: Study
31.article_body: Thirdhand smoke, which consists of dust particles from tobacco smoke that remain on surfaces, may trigger skin diseases. According to the study, acute exposure to these particles called THS elevates levels of molecules in the body linked to diseases like contact dermatitis and psoriasis. It may also lead to other diseases, such as cancer, heart disease, and atherosclerosis, researchers said.

32.title: ₹3 cr unaccounted cash seized in Rajasthan's Sirohi, 4 arrested
32.article_body: Four persons travelling in two cars with over ₹3 crore unaccounted cash were detained in Rajasthan's Sirohi district on Wednesday, police said. The cash was recovered from the cars coming from Ahmedabad, Sirohi SP Mamta Gupta confirmed. The police found bundles of notes wrapped in paper under the seats of the two cars at Maval post, DSP Yogesh Sharma said.

33.title: 'Squid Game' actor Anupam Tripathi meets Anurag Kashyap, shares pic
33.article_body: Actor Anupam Tripathi, who played the role of Ali in the South Korean series 'Squid Game', shared a picture with filmmaker Anurag Kashyap on Instagram. "Simply an amazing moment for me. I just had a meeting with one of my favourite film directors from India," Anupam wrote along with the picture. He thanked Anurag for the "short and awesome meeting".

34.title: Swing breaks down at school in UP, 1 child dead & another injured
34.article_body: One child died and another was injured after a swing broke down at a private school in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich. The injured student was referred to Lucknow. The family member of one of the children said, "We weren't even told what happened to [them]. We came to know that they were taken to district hospital when we came to school."

35.title: LIC sells over 2% stake in Power Grid for ₹3,079 crore in 5 months
35.article_body: Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) has sold over 2% of its holding in Power Grid Corporation over the past five months for ₹3,079.43 crore. "Corporation's shareholding in Power Grid...has diluted from 36,99,02,170 to 23,01,82,028 equity shares decreasing its shareholding from 5.303% to 3.3% of the paid-up capital of the said company," LIC said.

36.title: PVR receives shareholders approval for merger with INOX Leisure
36.article_body: Multiplex operator PVR said that it has received approval from its shareholders for the proposed merger with rivals INOX Leisure. PVR convened a meeting of its shareholders on Tuesday, following the directions of the Mumbai bench of the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT). The proposal was passed by over 99% of the number of valid votes cast.

37.title: India extends validity for sugar exports to US under quota till December 31
37.article_body: Directorate General of Foreign Trade (DGFT) said that the deadline to export raw sugar to the US under Tariff-Rate Quota (TRQ) has been extended till December 31. TRQ is the quota to export products to the US at relatively low tariffs. Total sugar exports to the US under TRQ would be around 10,475 tonnes during 2022, DGFT said in May.

38.title: Ukraine makes 'romantic' appeal to France for more weapons, shares video
38.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Ministry on Wednesday made a "romantic" appeal to France, urging the country to send more artillery to Ukraine amid Russian invasion. "Romantic gestures take many forms...But if you really want to win our hearts...nothing beats 155-mm highly mobile self-propelled artillery," the text in a video clip shared by the ministry read. France recently promised more arms to Ukraine.

39.title: Nehru delayed Kashmir's accession to India: Law Minister to Congress
39.article_body: Law Minister Kiren Rijiju on Wednesday said Jawaharlal Nehru delayed Kashmir's accession to India and the country is still paying the price for the ex-PM's follies. He was reacting to Congress' claim that Maharaja Hari Singh dithered on the question of accession. Rijiju claimed Singh had approached Nehru for accession to India in July 1947, but Nehru rejected his request.

40.title: RBI asks entities to stop taking ratings from Brickwork Ratings
40.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India has asked entities and market participants to stop taking fresh ratings and credit evaluations from Brickwork Ratings India Private Limited. On October 6, SEBI asked the credit rating agency to wind down operations and cancelled its Certificate of Registration (CoR). The instructions regarding existing ratings issued by Brickwork shall be advised separately, RBI said.

41.title: India's projected debt ratio to be 84% of GDP: IMF
41.article_body: Paolo Mauro, Deputy Director, Fiscal Affairs Department, International Monetary Fund, said India's debt ratio is projected to be 84% of its GDP by the end of 2022. Mauro stressed that it is important for India to have a very clear medium-term objective on the fiscal. "It would be very important to give reassurance that things are under control," he added.

42.title: Punjab govt allows green crackers from 8 pm to 10 pm on Diwali
42.article_body: Punjab Minister Gurmeet Singh Meet Hayer on Wednesday said only green crackers will be allowed for two hours from 8 pm on Diwali. He added crackers will be permitted from 4 am to 5 am and from 9 pm to 10 pm on 'Gurpurab'. They will be allowed from 11.55 pm to 12.30 am on Christmas and New Year.

43.title: Pak PM Shehbaz Sharif, son acquitted in PKR 16-billion money laundering case
43.article_body: Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif and his son Hamza were acquitted by a special court of the Federal Investigation Agency (FIA) in a money laundering case on Wednesday. The FIA had booked Sharif and his sons for allegedly committing over PKR 16 billion in money laundering in 2020. "Another fabricated case created for political victimisation comes to its...end," the PML-N tweeted.

44.title: Govt scraps privatisation of Bhadravati steel plant on low bidder interest
44.article_body: The Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) said the privatisation of SAIL’s Bhadravati steel plant has been scrapped due to low bidder interest. The transaction was annulled with the approval of Alternative Mechanism (Empowered Group of Ministers). DIPAM said multiple Expressions of Interest (EoIs) had been received and qualified bidders had conducted due diligence.

45.title: Salman Khan whitewashing his toxic masculinity: Sona on #MeToo accused Sajid
45.article_body: Speaking about Sajid Khan's participation in 'Bigg Boss 16', singer Sona Mohapatra tweeted that the show's host and actor Salman Khan is whitewashing his own toxic masculinity. "Continues the whitewashing in the BRO-HOOD...(Btw his gifting watches/food truck/surgeries is only more virtue signalling)," she added. Several women accused Sajid of sexual misconduct during the #MeToo movement in 2018.

46.title: Secret ballot for Cong Prez polls to ensure level playing field: CEA Mistry
46.article_body: The Presidential polls for the Congress party will have a secret ballot to ensure a level playing field for both Mallikarjun Kharge and Shashi Tharoor, the party's Central Election Authority Chairman Madhusudan Mistry said. Mistry further added that the polling authority cannot stop any individual from campaigning. The ballot papers will be mixed before counting starts, Mistry added.

47.title: India's factory output in August contracts for the first time in 18 months
47.article_body: India's Index of Industrial Production contracted 0.8% year-on-year in August for the first time in 18 months, according to government data released on Wednesday. Month-on-month, the index declined 2.3% compared with a decline of 2.9% in July. Mining output fell 3.9%, while manufacturing activity fell by 0.7%, indicating a broader slowdown in the country.

48.title: Mohammad Shami confirms he is going to Australia ahead of T20 WC, shares pics from flight
48.article_body: Pacer Mohammad Shami on Wednesday confirmed that he is going to Australia ahead of the T20 World Cup 2022. Sharing pictures from a flight on Instagram, the 32-year-old pacer wrote, "Time to fly now for T20 World Cup." Shami is reportedly in contention to replace the vacant spot left by injured Jasprit Bumrah in India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad.

49.title: Adda247 raises $35 million led by WestBridge Capital, Google and Info Edge
49.article_body: Ed-tech platform ﻿Adda247 announced raising $35 million in a round led by WestBridge Capital. The round also saw participation from Google as a new investor and existing investors, Info Edge and Asha Impact. The company said the funds will be used to enhance its tech and product profile, expand its student counselling team, and hiring for some key leadership roles.

50.title: HCL Tech net profit increases 7% to ₹3,489 crore in Q2
50.article_body: IT major HCL Technologies announced that its consolidated net profit saw a 7.05% year-on-year growth, taking it to ₹3,489 crore in the quarter ended September 2022. The company registered a revenue of ₹24,686 crore, clocking a 19.5% growth over ₹20,655 crore last year. Sequentially, revenue rose 5.2% from ₹23,464 crore in quarter ended June 2022.

51.title: Wipro registers ₹2,659 crore net profit in Q2 FY23; sees Y-o-Y decline of 9%
51.article_body: IT services firm Wipro released its Q2 results, reporting consolidated net profit of ₹2,659 crore, which was 9% less than ₹2,930 crore in the same period last year. The company's revenue from operations stood at ₹22,539.7 crore, a 14.60% increase over ₹19,667.4 crore in the previous year. Sequentially, profit rose 3.71% from ₹2563.6 crore in the previous quarter.

52.title: Got nose job to look prettier, it's my face, why wouldn't I: Shruti
52.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan said it is very obvious that she got her nose fixed as she did her first film with her "old nose". "My nose was broken...And people are like she's just using the deviated septum excuse," she said. "I did have a deviated septum...But if I could make it prettier, it's my face, why wouldn't I?" Shruti added.

53.title: Fireside Ventures raises $225 million for third fund
53.article_body: Fireside Ventures﻿ announced that it has raised third fund at $225 million (₹1,830 crore), which is the largest capital raised yet by the five-year-old firm. The early-stage investor said the new fund would invest in about 25-30 Indian startups focusing on the health and wellness, lifestyle and consumer goods categories. Investors include SBI, ITC and Premji Invest, among other firms.

54.title: ICC names 5 changes to playing conditions to keep an eye on during T20 World Cup
54.article_body: ICC named five changes to playing conditions to keep an eye on during T20 World Cup 2022. They include five-run penalty for unfair movement by fielding side, new batter to take strike after caught dismissals, in-match over penalty for slow over-rate, batters requiring to have some part of their bat/body within pitch and 'mankading', which is no longer 'unfair play'.

55.title: American Idol fame Willie shared video of him singing in car on Insta hours before death
55.article_body: Singer Willie Spence, who passed away in a car accident aged 23, had shared a video of himself singing inside a car hours before his accident. "Lord you are my hiding place," he had captioned the video. Reacting to his post, singer Katharine McPhee Foster wrote, "You're with Jesus now. God bless you. Thankful for the time we had."

56.title: Shouldn't boycott film when govt is doing best to better economy: Rakul
56.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh said the film industry suffers when a film gets boycotted. She added there's a chain reaction that follows after a film gets boycotted. "Employment goes down. At a time when the government is doing its best to better the economy, we shouldn't advocate these things," she added. Recently, several films faced 'boycott' calls on social media.

57.title: 25 lakh people affected due to floods after incessant rains in UP
57.article_body: Around 25 lakh people from 2,000 villages in Uttar Pradesh's 15 districts are affected due to floods after incessant rainfall in the state. The discharge from Nepal dams has resulted in the swelling of the Ramganga river in the Bareilly district. CM Yogi Adityanath made an aerial survey of flood-affected areas in the Balrampur, Shravasti and Gonda districts.

58.title: Mercedes-Benz, Microsoft collaborate to improve auto production
58.article_body: Mercedes-Benz and Microsoft have collaborated to use Microsoft Cloud for a data platform to improve production efficiency at auto plants around the world. According to a statement, the data platform is called MO360, and is presently available in Europe, the Middle East and Africa. The collaboration is aiming for a 20% increase in vehicle production efficiency by 2025.

59.title: Broccoli gas can help in finding life on other planets: Scientists
59.article_body: Scientists believe broccoli gas could help provide compelling evidence of life on other planets. In order to expel toxins, broccoli, like other organisms, adds one carbon and three hydrogen atoms to an unwanted chemical and turns the potential toxin into a gas that floats away into atmosphere safely. Detection of such gases on other planets may hint at alien life.

60.title: Delhi govt defying RTI Act fearing corruption exposure: BJP
60.article_body: The BJP has accused the AAP-led Delhi government for defying the RTI Act fearing exposure of its corrupt practices. BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia claimed that various departments such as education, health, transport or excise are marred by corrupt practices. Bhatia further said that the Delhi government has been running away from transparency and accountability.

61.title: ED raids premises of officials in Chhattisgarh; seizes ₹4 cr in cash
61.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate raided several premises in Chhattisgarh and recovered ₹4 crore in cash along with jewellery, in connection with a money laundering case. Reportedly, the raids were conducted at the premises of district collector, some senior officials, businessmen, and politicians of the ruling party. CM Bhupesh Baghel called the raids an "act of intimidation".

62.title: Reports of UGC-NET History paper leak are fake: NTA
62.article_body: The National Testing Agency (NTA) on Wednesday issued a statement saying that a fake tweet and YouTube video are circulating on social media regarding the leak of the History paper during the UGC-NET December 2021 and June 2022 (merged cycles) examination. The NTA denied the allegations. The exam was conducted on October 10.

63.title: HCLTech adds highest-ever 10,339 freshers, reports 23.8% attrition in Jul-Sept
63.article_body: HCLTech reported its highest-ever hiring of 10,339 freshers in July-September quarter, MD and CEO C Vijayakumar said on Wednesday. HCLTech's attrition rate in the quarter stood at 23.8%, same as that in April-June quarter. Meanwhile, the firm reported net employee addition of 8,359 employees in Q2 FY23, up from net employee addition of 2,089 employees in Q1 FY23.

64.title: Shivakumar wears T-shirt highlighting unemployment at Bharat Jodo Yatra
64.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar wore a T-shirt highlighting the issue of unemployment during the Bharat Jodo Yatra on Wednesday. Sharing an image of himself wearing the T-shirt, he tweeted, "Youth of Karnataka need jobs, not empty promises." He accused the BJP of making "hollow promises" regarding employment. Notably, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi met around 2,000 unemployed people on Wednesday.

65.title: Wipro to give 100% variable pay to 85% of employees in Q2 FY23: CEO
65.article_body: IT services firm Wipro's CEO Thierry Delaporte has said that the company will pay out 100% of variable pay to 85% of its employees for the second quarter. The remaining 15% of the employees will reportedly get their variable pay as per policy. The company's net profit fell 9.27% YoY to ₹2,659 crore in Q2 FY22.

66.title: BJP is the only national party left in India: Party chief JP Nadda
66.article_body: While addressing a gathering in Gujarat, BJP President JP Nadda said his party is the only national party left in India. Calling Congress "a party of a brother and sister", he claimed Congress leaders are only in the party for merriment and to serve a family. He said parties likes SP, TRS, TMC and RJD are carrying out dynasty politics.

67.title: Rupee drops 14 paise to close at 82.35 against US dollar
67.article_body: The Indian rupee declined by 14 paise to close at 82.35 against the US dollar on Wednesday. At the interbank foreign exchange market, the local currency opened at 82.32 and witnessed an intra-day high of 82.15 and a low of 82.37 against the American currency. The rupee touched a new record low of 82.67 against the US dollar on Monday.

68.title: SP leader writes to Prez, demands 'Bharat Ratna' for Mulayam Singh Yadav
68.article_body: In a letter to President Droupadi Murmu, SP leader IP Singh demanded that late SP founder and former UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav be conferred with the 'Bharat Ratna'. In a separate letter to UP CM Yogi Adityanath, Singh requested him to rename the Agra-Lucknow Expressway as the 'Dhartiputra Mulayam Singh Yadav' Expressway. Yadav passed away on Monday, aged 82.

69.title: Ready to fight legal battle to give justice to SCs & STs: K'taka CM
69.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday said that his government would do everything to give justice to the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes in the state. "We're ready to fight a legal battle to give justice to...SC/ST," Bommai said. Days after taking a decision to grant more reservations to the SCs/STs, Bommai accused Congress of trying to mislead the public.

70.title: How does the final medal tally of 36th National Games read?
70.article_body: The 36th National Games came to a conclusion on Wednesday, with Services Sports Control Board (SSCB) finishing on top of the medal tally with 61 gold medals. Maharashtra came second with 39 gold medals, while Haryana came third with 38 gold medals. Overall, Maharashtra won the most number of medals with 140, while SSCB won 128.

71.title: Loved Prashanth's work in 'KGF', he creates special world: Shruti Haasan
71.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan praised filmmaker Prashanth Neel for his work in the 'KGF' franchise. "I loved Prashanth sir's work in KGF and I think he really creates a special world that you get a grand feeling as an audience and actor," she added. Shruti will feature in Prashanth's 'Salaar', which also features 'Baahubali' actor Prabhas.

72.title: 200 tourists stranded due to heavy rains, landslides in Sikkim
72.article_body: Heavy rains and resultant landslides in Sikkim have left 200 tourists stranded and have also affected piped water supply to the state capital Gangtok, officials said on Wednesday. The rains are set to continue and the India Meteorological Department has issued a red alert in the state. There were reports of heavy rains in neighbouring north Bengal and Bhutan too.

73.title: OPEC cuts 2022 oil demand growth for 4th time amid rising inflation
73.article_body: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) cut its 2022 forecast for growth in world oil demand for the fourth time since April. OPEC said that oil demand will increase by 2.7% to 2.64 million barrels per day (bpd) in 2022, down 460,000 bpd from its previous forecast. It has also cut oil demand for next year by 3,60,000 bpd.

74.title: Prez Murmu gets all-women guard of honour from Tripura Police, pics surface
74.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu was accorded an all-women "guard of honour" on Wednesday, in a special gesture by the Tripura Police on her arrival in Agartala. President Murmu interacted with women tea workers of the Durgabari Tea Estate. "Are you getting free rice and benefits of other government schemes?" she asked one of the five-six female workers with whom she interacted.

75.title: Prez Droupadi Murmu interacts with women tea workers in Tripura
75.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu interacted with women tea workers of Durgabari Tea Estate in Agartala on Wednesday. "They represent the state's social diversity and seem satisfied with welfare initiatives for them," the President said in a tweet. She urged them to focus on education of their children, particularly girls. The President also laid the foundation stone of Tripura's National Law University.

76.title: Shah Rukh Khan books 5-star hotel rooms for fans, meets them individually; pics surface
76.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan recently booked 5-star hotel rooms for some of his fans and met them individually after finishing his shoot schedule for 'Jawan' in Chennai. "A manager along with two butlers were allotted to us," a fan said. "He gave us all enough time to interact, click pictures and even present him with our gifts," the fan added.

77.title: Video games could trigger heart attack in kids with cardiac problems: Study
77.article_body: According to a study, playing video games can trigger heart attacks in kids with underlying cardiac problems. Some kids are born with cardiac arrhythmia, an abnormal heartbeat, which remains untreated until a scan reveals it. The excitement, adrenaline, and emotional investment while playing video games can cause a flare-up leading to loss of consciousness, cardiac arrest, and even death.

78.title: It's definitely gonna blow up: Shekhar on music of SRK's 'Pathaan'
78.article_body: Music composer Shekhar Ravjiani took to Twitter and shared a picture of himself from the music studio. Along with his picture, he wrote, "Back to the musicverse of 'Pathaan' and the electrifying power of Shah Rukh Khan." He added, "It's definitely gonna blow up! It's positively going to get you off the floor! Need I say more?"

79.title: Indian, US oil and gas companies sign 4 MoUs for clean energy partnership
79.article_body: Indian and American gas and oil companies signed four major MoUs to strengthen the bilateral strategic clean energy partnership. The MoUs were signed by the Minister of Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri during a round table in Houston. Indian Oil, Aavantika Gas Limited, Engineers India Limited and Indraprastha Gas Limited were the companies to sign the MoU.

80.title: Google Pixel 6a, Pixel 7 to soon get 5G update in India
80.article_body: Google Pixel 6a and Pixel 7 smartphones will soon be getting a new update to enable their users to connect to the 5G network in India. Google has confirmed that it is working with Indian telecom operators to allow 5G functionality. Meanwhile, Samsung on Wednesday confirmed that it will enable 5G support on its Galaxy devices in India by mid-November.

81.title: Campaign to be conducted against tobacco & gutkha soon: MP Minister
81.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra said a campaign will be conducted against tobacco and gutkha soon in the state. Mishra also said that all hookah lounges have been closed across Madhya Pradesh. Over 43,000 litres of liquor have been seized and 360 cases have been registered under the NDPS Act, Mishra said, adding drug traders will not be spared.

82.title: India's geospatial economy to cross ₹63,000 crore by 2025: Minister
82.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh on Tuesday said that India's geospatial economy is expected to cross ₹63,000 crore by 2025 at a growth rate of 12.8%. He further said it will provide employment to more than 10 lakh people mainly through geospatial startups. He said this while addressing the Second United Nations World Geospatial Information Congress (UN-WGIC) 2022 in Hyderabad.

83.title: Register with education dept soon or shut down: U'khand govt to madrassas
83.article_body: Madrassas across Uttarakhand have been asked to register with the state education department within one month or face closure. "Not registering with the state education department is harming the future of the students who study [in those madrassas] as they face problems in getting admissions after class 5," a state minister said. There are around 400 unregistered madrassas in Uttarakhand.

84.title: Indian energy firms come together to develop carbon market
84.article_body: An alliance of key stakeholders in the carbon markets, the Carbon Markets Association of India (CMAI), has been formed to develop a carbon credit market to achieve energy transition goals. CMAI President Manish Dabkara said CMAI would act as a mediator between government and industries. The association includes Gautam Adani's Adani Group and Dabkara's EKI Energy Services, among other firms.

85.title: American Idol runner-up Willie Spence dies in car accident aged 23
85.article_body: Singer Willie Spence, who finished runner-up in 19th season of American Idol, passed away in a car accident aged 23. Willie was in Tennessee at the time of the accident. "Life's so unfair and nothing is ever promised...God rest your soul Willie. It was a pleasure to sing with you and to know you," singer Katharine McPhee wrote on Instagram.

86.title: FIR against ex-UP minister's aide for allegedly molesting Dalit woman
86.article_body: A case has been registered against former Uttar Pradesh Minister Swami Prasad Maurya's personal secretary and 12 others for allegedly molesting a Dalit woman and trying to kill her brothers in Lucknow. The woman has alleged that they passed casteist remarks and threatened to outrage her modesty. She added she complained about it to Maurya but he didn't take action.

87.title: Retail inflation averages at 7.02% in Jul-Sept, down from 7.28% in Apr-Jun
87.article_body: Retail inflation in India averaged at 7.02% in the July-September 2022 quarter, down from the 7.28% average inflation recorded in the April-June 2022 quarter, data from the Statistics Ministry released on Wednesday showed. Average inflation was at 6.34% in the January-March quarter of this year. Retail inflation was at 7.41% in September, up from 7% in August.

88.title: Olympic medallist Sushil Kumar to face trial for murder in 23-yr-old wrestler's death
88.article_body: Two-time Olympic medal-winning wrestler Sushil Kumar will face trial for murder in the death of 23-year-old wrestler Sagar Dhankar. A Delhi court today framed charges relating to murder, attempt to murder, rioting, unlawful assembly, and other sections, including criminal conspiracy, against Sushil and 17 others in the case. The court also framed charges against two accused who are absconding.

89.title: No citizen can be prosecuted under annulled section 66A of IT Act: SC
89.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday said that no citizen can be prosecuted under the annulled section 66A of the IT Act. Under section 66A, a person posting offensive content could be sentenced to up to three years in jail and also be fined. The apex court also directed authorities to not register any cases deemed to allegedly violate 66A.

90.title: Vicky & I get less time together, we've been away on shoots: Katrina
90.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif, speaking about her husband and actor Vicky Kaushal, has said that they get less time together. "He has been away a lot on shoots, as have I," the actress added. However, Katrina has said that Vicky is a wonderful person. "I think it's nice to have a person like that in my life," she further added.

91.title: Policing virtual world like shutting down speakeasies: Roblox Chief Scientist
91.article_body: Policing the virtual world is like "shutting down speakeasies", said Roblox Chief Scientist Morgan McGuire referring to US prohibition-era bars hiding from law enforcement. The firm is deploying bots to detect any dangerous content that players may have disguised. Users had reportedly created explicit private spaces, known as "condos", where people's digital avatars could engage in virtual sex.

92.title: 11 lakh railway employees to get 78 days' wages as productivity bonus
92.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Wednesday announced that the Centre has approved a productivity-linked bonus equivalent to the wage of 78 days for eligible non-gazetted railway employees. This will benefit more than 11 lakh non-gazetted railway employees and it will cost the government approximately ₹1,832 crore. The maximum amount payable per eligible railway employee is ₹17,951 for 78 days.

93.title: Human sacrifice-accused wasn't party worker, likely influenced by wife: CPI(M)
93.article_body: The CPI(M) on Wednesday said that one of the accused, Bhagaval Singh, in the Kerala human sacrifice case wasn't a party worker. "[Singh changed] after his second marriage, he became...religious...It might be the influence of his wife," a party leader said. Three people have been sent to 14-day judicial custody over the mutilation and murder of two women in Pathanamthitta.

94.title: MobiKwik raises more debt, changes ESOP policy: Report
94.article_body: MobiKwik has raised total debt of ₹55 crore since August from BlackSoil and Alternative Investment Fund, Karnation, according to two Registrar of Companies filings. MobiKwik's board passed a resolution for allotment of 900 non-convertible debentures, in tranches of 700 and 200, to raise ₹35 crore and ₹10 crore from BlackSoil. MobiKwik has also reportedly made changes to its ESOP policy.

95.title: Haridwar on alert as dengue cases rise, 173 cases reported so far
95.article_body: Haridwar has been witnessing a rise in dengue cases with 173 infections being reported so far, said District Malaria Officer Gurnam Singh. "ASHA workers are conducting insecticide spraying inside residential buildings," Singh said, adding all agencies are working together for dengue prevention. "Anti-larvae spray and fogging being done in open areas with standing water," a civic official said.

96.title: CCTV footage shows 32-year-old businessman being shot dead in Delhi
96.article_body: A 32-year old businessman identified as Mohit Arora was allegedly shot dead in Delhi's Uttam Nagar area. According to reports, the alleged incident took place on Monday, when Arora's elder brother was riding the scooter and the deceased was sitting pillion. In a CCTV footage, the assailants can be seen shooting Arora dead and escaping from the scene.

97.title: Couldn't finish watching 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', it was scary: Katrina
97.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif has said that she couldn't finish watching Kartik Aaryan-starrer 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. Explaining the reason behind it, the 'Phone Bhoot' actress said, "I had to like cover my eyes. When Tabu comes all that even though I know that there is humour inside of it, even for me that was very very scary."

98.title: 'Teri Mitti' was among toughest songs I've sung, it's powerful: Praak
98.article_body: Singer B Praak has said that 'Teri Mitti' was one of the toughest songs he has sung. "It's a powerful song that tells an incredible story and invokes patriotic fervour. So, to do justice to it was something I was very adamant about," he added. The song featured in Akshay Kumar and Parineeti Chopra's 2019 film 'Kesari'.

99.title: Transgenders walk with Rahul during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in K'taka
99.article_body: Members of the transgender community met Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in Karnataka during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and shared their stories with him, while highlighting the need for generating employment for them. Gandhi said that the ruling BJP and RSS have always been against the transgender community and agreed that there is a need for equality among all sections of society.

100.title: Radio-collared tiger goes missing from Rajaji Tiger Reserve in U'khand
100.article_body: A radio-collared tiger has gone missing from the Rajaji Tiger Reserve in Uttarakhand nearly two years after being translocated from Corbett Tiger Reserve. It has been more than two weeks since the tiger went missing, Chief Wildlife Warden Samir Sinha said. It's possible that the tiger either dropped its radio collar or battery of the device ran out, Sinha added.

101.title: 'I'll come back': Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut writes to mother from jail
101.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut, who is in judicial custody in Patra Chawl land scam case, has written a letter to his mother. "Mother, I will definitely come back. The soul of Maharashtra and our country cannot be killed so easily," he wrote. Raut added, "Don't worry though, Uddhav Thackeray and Shiv Sainiks will take care of you."

102.title: Amitabh Bachchan is still naughty & sometimes grumpy on sets: Hema Malini
102.article_body: Actress Hema Malini said that veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan was "very quiet" when they worked together for the first time. Hema and Amitabh worked together in several films like 'Sholay' and 'Baghban'. She stated that Amitabh hasn't changed at all. "He's still very naughty, mischievous...sometimes serious and grumpy. He changes the mood on the sets with his entry," she added.

103.title: Class 7 Odisha boy immolates self as parents don't allow him to stay back longer
103.article_body: A 12-year-old boy, who had come home on holiday from his boarding school, reportedly immolated himself after his parents didn't allow him to stay back longer in Odisha's Cuttack. The class 7 boy's mother said he was unwilling to return to the boarding school after the Durga Puja vacation. He has been hospitalised and is reportedly in a serious condition.

104.title: Rape-accused police officer in Hyd dismissed without inquiry
104.article_body: Inspector K Nageswara Rao of Marredpally police station in Hyderabad, who was allegedly accused of kidnapping and sexually assaulting a woman at gunpoint, was dismissed without any inquiry, as per a police statement. The statement added that there wouldn't be an atmosphere to conduct a free and fair inquiry. Rao was suspended, arrested, and remanded to judicial custody.

105.title: Construction of mosques at Hyd Secretariat nearly completed: Wakf Board
105.article_body: The Telangana Wakf Board told the High Court that the construction of two mosques razed at the Secretariat in Hyderabad is almost completed. The state government informed the court that the construction of the temple is half-completed and soon will be ready for performing prayers. When the old Secretariat was razed, three religious places were also razed with them.

106.title: Byju's to lay off around 2,500 employees
106.article_body: World's most valued edtech startup Byju's said it'll lay off around 2,500 employees. "To avoid redundancies and duplication of roles, and by leveraging technology better, around 5% of BYJU'S 50,000-strong workforce is expected to be rationalised across product, content, media, and technology teams in phased manner," the company said. Byju's had laid off hundreds of employees in June as well.

107.title: TN govt notifies India's first Slender Loris sanctuary in Karur & Dindigul
107.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government on Wednesday notified the country's first Slender Loris sanctuary covering an area of 11,806 hectares in the state's Karur and Dindigul districts. "The sanctuary [is]...yet another milestone in Tamil Nadu's conservation efforts," said CM MK Stalin. Slender Loris is a biological predator of pests in agricultural crops and benefits farmers.

108.title: Rachakonda Police inaugurate CCTV camera network at Keesara
108.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police along with Nagaram Municipal Council installed 116 closed circuit cameras in Keesara. Telangana Minister for Labour and Employment Chamakura Malla Reddy inaugurated the cameras on Wednesday. Installing surveillance cameras would provide round-the-clock security to the citizens, Reddy said. Rachakonda Commissionerate has a lakh surveillance cameras installed, he added.

109.title: Kejriwal used Punjab Police for political ambitions: Tajinder Bagga
109.article_body: Soon after Punjab and Haryana HC quashed an FIR registered against him, Delhi BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga said that Delhi CM asked the Punjab Police to register a false case against him. "The Punjab Police were used by Kejriwal for his personal political ambitions," he alleged, adding that Kejriwal has defamed them.

110.title: Flying, sale of sky lanterns prohibited in Mumbai for 30 days
110.article_body: Mumbai Police have prohibited flying, sale and storage of sky lanterns ahead of Diwali. The prohibitory order is applicable for 30 days (October 16-November 14) in Mumbai Police Commissionerate area. Any person contravening this order shall be punishable under Section 188 of the Indian Penal Code. A police official said the use of lanterns may cause danger to human life.

111.title: K'taka CM having breakfast at Dalit's house is 'photo-op': Cong
111.article_body: Congress on Wednesday criticised Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai for having breakfast at a Dalit's house, saying that he did it as a "photo-op" for votes ahead of the Assembly elections in the state next year. The government has done nothing for the welfare of Dalits but is now remembering SCs and STs as elections are approaching, said Congress leader Siddaramaiah.

112.title: Can't you become bhaijaan to wronged women: Sherlyn to Salman on Sajid joining Bigg Boss
112.article_body: Sherlyn Chopra, who had accused filmmaker Sajid Khan of sexual misconduct, has questioned Salman Khan for having the #MeToo accused on 'Bigg Boss 16'. "The message that's going out...is that it's okay to molest a woman," she said. "I don't understand what has happened to Salman Khan....You call yourself...bhaijaan, can't you become bhaijaan to us wronged women?" Sherlyn added.

113.title: Retail inflation rises to a 5-month high of 7.41% in September
113.article_body: The country’s retail inflation, which is measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), rose to a five-month high of 7.41% in the month of September, government data showed. The CPI stood at 7% in August, 6.71% in July, 7.01% in June and 7.04% in May. In April, the CPI had hit an eight-year-high of 7.79%.

114.title: Chennai man stabs wife for uploading duet videos with other men on social media
114.article_body: A 20-year-old man reportedly stabbed his wife with a knife for uploading duet videos with other men on social media. According to police, the couple used to fight regularly as the woman uploaded videos of her performing songs with strangers. On Monday night, the accused reportedly went home drunk and picked up a fight with his wife and stabbed her.

115.title: New Vande Bharat train to cut Chandigarh-Delhi route to less than 3 hrs
115.article_body: India's fourth Vande Bharat Express, which PM Narendra Modi will flag off on Thursday, will reduce the travel time from Chandigarh to Delhi to less than three hours. The train will have advanced state-of-the-art safety features for commuters travelling from Una to Delhi. The train will boast reclining seats as well as an automatic fire sensor, reports said.

116.title: People felt I was talking about my depression to promote a film: Deepika
116.article_body: Deepika Padukone, in a conversation with Meghan Markle, revealed many people thought she was either promoting a film or was being paid by a pharmaceutical company when she opened up about her depression. "They thought I was being paid by a pharmaceutical company and you know that I'm now going to start advertising for some sort of medication," she added.

117.title: 2 groups fight over seats in Sinhagad Express train; video surfaces
117.article_body: A fight over seats reportedly broke out between two groups travelling on the Sinhagad Express train. A video of the incident where passengers are seen pushing and pulling each other has gone viral on social media. The video also shows some people trying to solve the matter. The fight reportedly took place between the train's passengers and Chakarmanis (workers).

118.title: PM cries that we've outsourced job of abusing him to AAP wrong: Cong
118.article_body: Congress spokesperson Jairam Ramesh on Wednesday said, "PM [Narendra Modi] cries that Congress has outsourced 'abusing' him to AAP [are] completely wrong!" "We only point out the litany of falsehoods that flow from the PM's mouth, every time he opens it," he added. This comes a day after PM Modi said that Congress has "outsourced" the contract of abusing him.

119.title: 25% of shops surveyed on Oct 10 lacked Marathi signboards: BMC
119.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) officials on Monday visited 2,158 shops across Mumbai to see if they had put up Marathi signboards and found that 1,636 or 75% had complied. "There were 522 shops which didn't display Marathi boards. We have issued notices to them," a BMC official said. The third deadline for implementing Marathi signboards ended on September 30.

120.title: 191 drones entered India from Pak in 9 months, 7 shot down: Report
120.article_body: Security forces have observed the illegal entry of 191 drones into Indian territory from Pakistan in the past nine months, ANI reported after accessing an official document. While 171 drones had entered into Indian territory through the India-Pakistan border along the Punjab sector, 20 were spotted in the Jammu sector, the report added. BSF personnel reportedly shot down seven drones.

121.title: Cong must decentralise authority: Tharoor ahead of party's chief poll
121.article_body: Congress Presidential poll candidate Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday said that the party must decentralise authority and truly empower the grassroots office-bearers of the party. "If elected as Congress chief, important first step will be to call for polls to CWC to spread inner-party democracy further," Tharoor added. The Congress Presidential poll will be held on October 17.

122.title: Wipro's net employee addition falls to 605, attrition down to 23% in Jul-Sept
122.article_body: IT services firm Wipro on Wednesday said its net employee addition during the July-September 2022 quarter was 605 people, down from 15,446 employees it hired in the April-June 2022 quarter. Wipro's attrition rate for Q2 FY23 was 23%, down from 23.3% recorded in Q1 FY23. Wipro was the only IT major to report a fall in attrition in last quarter.

123.title: Bangalore University students call off protest on ministers' assurance
123.article_body: The students of Bangalore University's Jnana Bharathi campus have called off their protest which started after a BMTC bus ran over a 23-year-old post-graduate student on Monday. The students demanded a ban on the movement of public vehicles inside the campus. They stopped the protest after Karnataka ministers assured them that the issue will be discussed with CM Basavaraj Bommai.

124.title: Told Big B 'Marry me, I'm in love with you' when I was 10: Swetha Menon
124.article_body: Malayalam actress Swetha Menon recalled an incident when she proposed to veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan when she was a 10-year-old girl. She said Amitabh had come to Allahabad to immerse the ashes of ex-Prime Minister Indira Gandhi. "There was absolute silence...I reached Bachchan and told him to please 'marry me as I am in love with you'," she stated.

125.title: India never believed in expansion, particularly of geographical boundaries: VP
125.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Wednesday said any expansion, particularly of geographical boundaries, involves a violation of human rights and that India as a nation never believed in such a policy. In his address at the Foundation Day of NHRC, he said Indian ethos is such that the country's concern is not limited to itself but cares for the world.

126.title: Bombs, claymore mines hidden by Maoists unearthed in Maha forest
126.article_body: Police have unearthed two live pressure cooker bombs and two claymore mines which were hidden in a forest by Maoists in Maharashtra's Gadchiroli district. A pistol, two wire bundles and an aluminium utensil were also recovered. Police had conducted a search operation after receiving an input on Tuesday that Maoists had buried explosives in the area to harm security forces.

127.title: Delhi has received 128.2 mm rain so far this month, highest for Oct in 66 years
127.article_body: Delhi has recorded 128.2 mm rainfall so far this month, the highest for October in 66 years, India Meteorological Department said. Delhi had received 236.2 mm rainfall in October 1956, while the all-time record rainfall for the month, at 238.2 mm, was recorded in 1954. Rainfall recorded this month is the fourth highest rainfall ever recorded in Delhi in October.

128.title: Hyderabad Police busts ₹900 cr investment fraud racket, 10 arrested
128.article_body: The Hyderabad Cyber Crime Police on Wednesday arrested 10 people, including a Chinese national, for their alleged involvement in a ₹900 crore investment fraud spread across the country. According to a police official, raids were conducted on a few call centres operating from Delhi and other places, following which the network of the fake investment companies was broken.

129.title: Slower ones are not that effective against someone like Kohli: Harshal
129.article_body: India pacer Harshal Patel has said that his slower deliveries are more effective when players go deep in the crease and try to slog. "For someone like Virat Kohli, whenever I've played against him, he steps out and makes it a full toss and plays it through midwicket," added Harshal. Harshal has picked three wickets in his last six T20Is.

130.title: Aaj pehli baar laga bin suraj ke uga savera: Akhilesh after father's funeral
130.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav shared a tweet a day after his father Mulayam Singh Yadav was cremated with full state honours. "Aaj pehli baar laga…bin suraj ke uga savera (For the first time it felt as if morning arrived without the sun)," Akhilesh Yadav tweeted. He also shared two pictures from the site where the SP founder was cremated.

131.title: Crypto firm Blockchain.com gets Singapore licence a day after Coinbase
131.article_body: Blockchain.com, a cryptocurrency exchange backed by Lightspeed Venture Partners, has said that it has received approval from Singapore's central bank to offer services in the city-state. The announcement comes a day after cryptocurrency exchange company, Coinbase, received the same approval. There are total 18 cryptocurrency exchange firms allowed to operate in Singapore.

132.title: Who knew Modi before 2002 riots: JDU Chief Nitish Kumar
132.article_body: JDU chief Nitish Kumar alleged it was in the light of the Gujarat riots that headlines with the name of Prime Minister Narendra Modi appeared. "Who knew Modi before 2002 riots?" he said. "During the JP movement, I went to jail," he added. The remark came after Amit Shah accused Nitish Kumar of betraying Jayaprakash Narayan and siding with Congress.

133.title: Rahul walks with families of organ donors during Bharat Jodo Yatra in K’taka
133.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, during the Bharat Jodo Yatra, on Wednesday walked along with the families of people who donated their organs. The yatra resumed from Karnataka's Challakere today morning. "Today, Bharat yatris are joined by families who donated organs of their deceased loved ones. Their selfless gesture is helping raise awareness about this important issue," Congress tweeted.

134.title: 2 Delhi govt schools top EW India School Rankings, 'proud of my team', says CM
134.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday congratulated his "Team Education" after two Delhi government schools topped the EducationWorld India School Rankings 2022-23. Rajkiya Pratibha Vikas Vidyalaya in Dwarka's Sector-10 and Yamuna Vihar secured the first and second positions respectively. Kejriwal added that five of the top 10 state government schools in India are from Delhi.

135.title: Thane court fines 2 food joint owners for serving liquor without permit
135.article_body: A court in Thane has imposed a fine of ₹27,000 each on the owners of two food joints for serving liquor to customers without permit. The two owners were found guilty for offences under the Maharashtra Prohibition Act. The court also found nine customers guilty of consuming liquor at the two food joints, located in Bhiwandi and Kongaon.

136.title: Video shows man burning under a bus as policemen escape from the vehicle in Bihar
136.article_body: Three people were killed when a bus carrying policemen hit their motorcycle on the Chapra-Siwan Highway in Bihar. Video shows one of the three killed under the bus as it caught fire after its fuel tank exploded. Policemen can be seen rushing out of the bus. The man was allegedly dragged for about 90 metres, during which the tank exploded.

137.title: Vecmocon raises $5.2 million from Tiger Global & Blume Ventures
137.article_body: Deep tech EV solutions company Vecmocon has secured $5.2 million in a pre-Series A funding round co-led by Tiger Global and Blume Ventures. The startup was co-founded in 2016 by Peeyush Asati, Shivam Wankhede and Adarshkumar Balaraman, alumni of IIT Kanpur, IIT Delhi and ISB, respectively. In 2019, Vecmocon had raised $300,000 in a seed round led by Tessellate Ventures.

138.title: $1.5-million floating house prototype in Panama partially sinks during unveiling
138.article_body: A prototype of a floating house worth $1.5 million partially sank during its unveiling in Panama. The luxury SeaPod constructed by Ocean Builders comprised 'three half floors' and over 300 square feet of living space, housed 7.5 feet above the water. While pictures of the tilted SeaPod surfaced on social media, the company said "not a single person was injured".

139.title: Got admission to my school because of Amitabh Bachchan: Ishaan Khatter
139.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter revealed that Amitabh Bachchan helped him to get admission to his school. "He was the reason why I got admission to my school," Ishaan said, adding that the legendary actor "paid a personal visit to the authorities and the principal". Talking about Amitabh Bachchan, Ishaan shared, "There's so much to learn just by watching him."

140.title: Big score is around the corner: NZ coach Stead on Williamson's form
140.article_body: New Zealand head coach Gary Stead, on being asked about their captain Kane Williamson's recent performances, said a "big score" is around the corner for the 32-year-old. "Kane is one of the hardest workers I have seen on his game and he continues to be," added Stead. Notably, Williamson hasn't crossed the 50-run mark in his last six T20I innings.

141.title: Yoho raises ₹20 crore in funding round led by Paytm Founder, others
141.article_body: Footwear startup Yoho has raised ₹20 crore in a funding round led by Paytm Founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma, Softbank Vision Fund CEO, Rajeev Misra and Rukam Capital, among other investors. Founded in 2021 by Prateek Singhal and Ahmad Hushsham, the firm manufactures lightweight orthopaedic footwear using AI and state-of-the-art technology. Currently, Yoho only sells footwear in three variants.

142.title: 1st blow to Dogra culture: Mehbooba Mufti on Jammu voters registration
142.article_body: Following the administration’s order facilitating people residing for over one year in Jammu to register as voters, PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said, "GoI's colonial settler project has been initiated in Jammu." She added, "They'll bear first blow to Dogra culture, identity, employment and business...BJP's attempts to create religious...regional divisions between Jammu and Kashmir must be thwarted."

143.title: SaaS startup MakerDojo raises $1.5 million in pre-seed funding round
143.article_body: Blockchain SaaS startup MakerDojo has secured $1.5 million in a pre-seed funding round led by Leo Capital. The round saw participation from US-based investors UP2398 and Jan Leeman. The company was co-founded in 2021 by Stanford graduates Priyank Chodisetti, Vignesh Aigal and Ajay Chintala. MakerDojo supports blockchain protocols like Celo, Ethereum, Polygon and NEAR.

144.title: Hyderabad Police seize ₹2 crore hawala money, 4 persons arrested
144.article_body: The Hyderabad Police busted a hawala racket on Tuesday night and seized around ₹2 crore cash which was being shifted illegally. Based on a tip-off, the Commissioner's Task Force (west) team along with Banjara Hills Police stopped a car and found the cash, after which four persons were apprehended. On Saturday, ₹79 lakh hawala money was seized in Hyderabad.

145.title: Next Budget to be carefully structured, inflation to be addressed: FM
145.article_body: The next annual Union Budget will have to be very carefully structured to sustain the country's growth momentum, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Tuesday. "Growth priorities will be kept absolutely on the top. Even as I speak about the concerns that inflation brings before me. So, inflation concerns will have to be addressed," the Finance Minister said.

146.title: Beliefs hurt by distorting traditions, Aamir should keep this in mind: Minister on bank ad
146.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra has criticised a bank advertisement featuring actors Aamir Khan and Kiara Advani. Mishra said that religious beliefs are hurt by distorting Indian traditions as the ad shows a couple reaching the bride's house and the groom taking the first step into the house. The minister said Aamir should do advertisements keeping this in mind.

147.title: Film festival in works to celebrate Dilip Kumar's 100th birth anniversary
147.article_body: Film Heritage Foundation (FHF) founder Shivendra Singh Dungarpur said that the organisation is planning a film festival to honour late actor Dilip Kumar on his 100th birth anniversary. "There's no better way to celebrate his legacy," Dungarpur said, adding that the challenge is to find the right material for the festival. FHF had recently organised 'Bachchan: Back To The Beginning'.

148.title: Over 250 startups working in geospatial sector in India: Minister
148.article_body: Minister of State for Earth Sciences Jitendra Singh said India has over 250 startups in the geospatial sector. He added that India jumping from rank 80 to 40 on the Global Innovation Index is a testimony to the country's progress in the last eight to nine years. Singh added that the geospatial economy will generate employment on a large scale.

149.title: UK economy shrinks in August by 0.3% due to fall in production
149.article_body: Britain's gross domestic product contracted by 0.3% in August, the Office for National Statistics said on Wednesday. The contraction was led by production and services falling back. Consumer-facing services contracted by 1.8%, with the largest falls in sports, amusement and recreation. GDP growth in July was revised down to 0.1% from a previous estimate of 0.2%, ONS said.

150.title: RBI cancels certificate of registration for 4 NBFCs
150.article_body: The RBI on Wednesday cancelled the certificate of registration of four non-banking financial companies (NBFCs), which are SRM Properties And Finance Company, North East Region Finservices, Sowjenvee Finance and Opel Finance. This move comes amid growing complaints against app-based moneylenders harassing borrowers over repayment. Four other NBFCs also surrendered their registration certificate.

151.title: TVS Motor beats Hero MotoCorp to become 6th most-valued auto firm
151.article_body: TVS Motor Company Limited has become the sixth most-valuable listed automobile company with its share price surging 72% so far in 2022. BSE data showed its market capitalisation reaching ₹51,071 crore after its shares surged 1.9% on Wednesday. TVS has surpassed Hero MotoCorp, whose market capital stood at ₹50,968 crore. TVS' stock has surged over 100% since its March lows.

152.title: Police identify 10 traffic hotspots in Ghaziabad ahead of festival season
152.article_body: Ghaziabad Traffic Police identified at least 10 major road junctions that witness heavy volume of traffic and frequent snarls and could add to the air pollution during the festive season. The identified hotspots are Bhopura crossing, New Bus Adda roundabout, Delhi-Meerut road, major markets in Indirapuram and Vaishali, Apsara Border and Lal Kuan, among others, the traffic police said.

153.title: Marco Jansen replaces Dwaine Pretorius in SA's squad for T20 WC
153.article_body: South Africa all-rounder Marco Jansen has replaced Dwaine Pretorius in their squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia. Pretorius sustained a fracture in his left thumb during the third T20I against India and was subsequently ruled out of the World Cup. Interestingly, Jansen has played only one T20I in his career so far.

154.title: Bengaluru-Mumbai plane lands with fairing panel missing; probe on
154.article_body: A fairing panel on one wing of an AirAsia plane, which was carrying over 140 passengers, was found to be missing during its post-flight inspection after landing in Mumbai. The aircraft had landed from Bengaluru. Meanwhile, DGCA has launched an investigation into the matter. Notably, a fairing panel is responsible for producing a smooth outline and reducing an aircraft's drag.

155.title: We know the 'Lakshman Rekha' but have to examine demonetisation: SC
155.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday said it will examine the decision-making process behind demonetisation carried out in 2016 and asked the Centre and RBI to file affidavits regarding it. "We always know where the 'Lakshman Rekha' is, but the manner in which it was done has to be examined," a five-judge bench said.

156.title: Pic showing 1 AC split between 2 rooms at Mumbai hotel goes viral
156.article_body: A picture showing one AC split between two hotel rooms in Mumbai has gone viral. Podcaster Anurag Minus Verma said the hotel's manager had promised him a room with a split AC. He added, "It was literally a split AC room...One half in ours and rest in another where two uncles were playing 'Aye Ganpat chal daaru la'...in full volume."

157.title: Twitter reviews policies on permanently banning users: Report
157.article_body: Twitter is reviewing its policies around permanently banning users and exploring if there are other content moderation tools to replace a ban, as per a report. In May, Elon Musk said he would reverse Twitter's ban on former US President Donald Trump. However, Twitter is not considering reversing bans issued for breaching its policy against inciting violence, the report added.

158.title: Govt ready to talk with startups to make them stay in India: FM
158.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the government is ready to address the concerns of the startups to make them stay in India. She added, "Engagement with the startups is what is going to help them to remain...within India. But, if there are temptations for which they...want to go outside, we need to understand how much we can entertain...on those courses."

159.title: Gurugram man calls NGO staffer to house for 'donation', molests her
159.article_body: A man in Gurugram was arrested for reportedly molesting a woman who works for a Non-Governmental Organisation (NGO). The accused reportedly called the woman to his house on the pretext of offering a donation. When she reached there he bolted the door and started misbehaving with her. As she objected, he started molesting her and even tore her clothes.

160.title: Demolish illegal constructions or face action: BMC to Goregaon Sports Club
160.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has sent two notices to Goregaon Sports Club in Malad (West) within a week, warning it of action against unauthorised constructions being carried out on the premises. According to the civic body, the club is violating fire safety norms. The club president, however, denied BMC's claim and blamed the opposition for spreading misinformation.

161.title: Stoltenberg's comment confirms NATO is fighting in Ukraine: Kremlin
161.article_body: Reacting to NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg's comments on Ukraine war, the Kremlin said it could be considered confirmed that NATO is fighting on Ukraine's side in the conflict with Russia. Stoltenberg had said that Russia's victory in Ukraine would be a "defeat for all of us". He had also said that Russian President Vladimir Putin is failing in Ukraine.

162.title: Coal India signs deals with BHEL, IOC, GAIL (India) for 4 projects
162.article_body: Coal India Limited has signed agreements with Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited, Indian Oil Corporation and GAIL (India) to set up four surface gasification projects. It aims to gasify 100 million tonnes of coal into syngas, which is a mixture of carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide and hydrogen. The projects would reduce forex outgo and create nearly 23,000 jobs, Coal Ministry said.

163.title: Govt to give ₹22,000-crore grant to 3 state-run oil firms to cover LPG losses
163.article_body: The Centre will provide a one-time grant of ₹22,000 crore to Indian Oil Corporation, Bharat Petroleum Corporation and Hindustan Petroleum Corporation, to cover their losses for selling domestic cooking gas LPG below cost in the last two years. These firms sell domestic LPG at government-regulated prices to consumers. Between June 2020-June 2022, international LPG prices rose by around 300%.

164.title: 'Yaariyan 2' to star Priya Prakash Varrier, Meezaan and Pearl V Puri
164.article_body: T-Series on Wednesday announced the sequel of the 2014 film 'Yaariyan' with an ensemble cast consisting of Pearl V Puri, Priya Prakash Varrier, Meezaan, and Yash Daasguptaa, among others. While the first film marked the directorial debut of Divya Khosla Kumar, 'Yaariyan 2' will be directed by Radhika Rao and Vinay Sapru. The film will release on May 12, 2023.

165.title: Over 20 arrested for allegedly attacking RSS worker in Karnataka's Haveri
165.article_body: Over 20 people were arrested for allegedly attacking a Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) worker at a village in Karnataka's Haveri on Tuesday night, police said. The RSS worker was at Rattehalli village for a path-laying work when the incident happened, as per reports. The victim was allegedly attacked by members of another community after an argument broke out, reports added.

166.title: Muslim man donates land for Hanuman temple in UP's Shahjahanpur
166.article_body: A Muslim man donated a portion of his land in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur to allow shifting of a Hanuman temple that was blocking a project to widen the Delhi-Lucknow NH-24, said an official. "Babu Ali gave one 'bigha' land situated close to the project to the administration," said Additional District Magistrate Ram Sevak Dwivedi.

167.title: Marksans Pharma's stock surges 12% after deal with Tevapharm India
167.article_body: Shares of Marksans Pharma surged by nearly 12% on Wednesday after it announced a plan for a business transfer agreement with Tevapharm India Private Limited. Marksans will acquire Tevapharm's manufacturing and supply of bulk pharmaceutical formulations business in Goa on a slump sale basis. At 2:50 pm, Marksans Pharma's stock was trading 5.68% higher at ₹49.30 apiece on the BSE.

168.title: Like Malinga, Wanindu Hasaranga is a competitor: Mahela Jayawardena
168.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena has praised spinner Wanindu Hasaranga, stating that the 25-year-old has delivered in "tough situations" for his team in the last 12 months. "Once Wanindu crosses the field, like Lasith Malinga, he's a competitor...that's what I love about him," added Jayawardena. Wanindu was named 'Player of the Tournament' in the 2022 Asia Cup.

169.title: Dacoits thrash truck driver, loot cigarettes worth ₹1.3 cr on Mumbai-Ahm highway
169.article_body: Six unidentified armed dacoits reportedly looted cigarettes worth ₹1.36 crore from a truck on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad highway on Tuesday morning. They waylaid the truck near Sakwar village, beat up the driver mercilessly, blindfolded him and drove off with the truck, police said. After emptying the truck, they abandoned it and released the driver near the Charoti toll booth, police added.

170.title: 32 Solomon Island police officers head to China for training
170.article_body: A group of 32 police officers from Solomon Islands have been sent to China for training in policing techniques, the Royal Solomon Islands Police Force said. The officers would visit different police stations in China during their month-long visit. China has provided public order management training to police in the Solomon Islands since a security pact was signed in April.

171.title: I may not be most talented, but I'm the hardest working: Janhvi Kapoor
171.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has said that people have the "biggest misconception" about her that she takes her position for granted. "I may not be the most talented or the most beautiful...but I can promise you that I'm the hardest-working person on the set," she added. Janhvi recently featured in 'Good Luck Jerry' and will next star in 'Bawaal'.

172.title: Couple hurt after ceiling plaster of house falls on them in Thane
172.article_body: A couple was reportedly injured after plaster from the ceiling of an apartment in a ground-plus-two-storey building collapsed on them in Thane on Tuesday. The 26-year-old man and his 22-year-old wife had occupied a flat on second floor of the building above a public toilet. They also maintained the toilet. Following the accident, the couple was rushed to a hospital.

173.title: Railway gateman found dead on tracks in UP's Sultanpur
