173.article_body: A railway gateman, identified as Pradeep Kumar Mishra, was found dead on the Ayodhya-Prayagraj railway section in Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur on Wednesday morning, police said. The deceased's family said that he had come home on Tuesday morning after work and left in the night, police added. The family suspects that the deceased was murdered, police further said.

174.title: 'Seduce Goddess Saraswati' to perform well in studies: BJP MLA
174.article_body: A video of BJP MLA Bansidhar Bhagat has gone viral on the internet, in which he can be seen asking students to "patao Goddess Saraswati" to perform well in their studies. While speaking to women on the International Day of the Girl Child, Bhagat said, "If you want power, Goddess Durga can be pleased."

175.title: Both India, Pak don't have enough all-rounders, it's been an issue: Nasser
175.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain has said both India and Pakistan lack a proper number seven player in their squads for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "If you have a solid number seven, then...your top six can absolutely go for it. That has been an issue for India [and Pakistan]...Babar and Rizwan are so worried about their [batting] depth," stated Hussain.

176.title: Samsung to enable 5G support in its devices in India by mid-Nov
176.article_body: Samsung on Wednesday confirmed that it will be enabling 5G support in its 5G-ready Galaxy devices in India through a software update in mid-November. "In India, Samsung has the widest portfolio of 5G devices. We're working closely with our operator partners [to enable]...Indian consumers to experience 5G seamlessly," a Samsung spokesperson said. Apple will launch 5G support in December 2022.

177.title: Passengers escape unhurt as bus catches fire in Pune, video surfaces
177.article_body: As many as 27 passengers escaped unhurt after a private bus they were travelling in caught fire in Pune on Wednesday. As soon as the fire was noticed, the bus driver alerted the passengers and they managed to deboard it immediately, police said. However, the passengers' luggage was damaged. Meanwhile, a video has surfaced online, showing flames engulfing the bus.

178.title: Ganguly's removal as BCCI Prez another example of BJP's vendetta: TMC
178.article_body: TMC on Tuesday said that Sourav Ganguly's removal as BCCI President is another example of BJP's political vendetta. Talking about the incident, TMC MP Santanu Sen claimed that BJP's Amit Shah visited Ganguly's house a few months back and he was given several opportunities to join BJP. Was Ganguly removed because he's from Mamata Banerjee's state? Sen asked.

179.title: For every Azad & Scindia who leave, Cong have 25 others: Ramesh
179.article_body: Talking about senior leaders quitting the party, Congress spokesperson Jairam Ramesh said, "For every Azad (Ghulam Nabi Azad) and Scindia (Jyotiraditya Scindia), Congress will have 25 others". "The party's youth cadre is getting strong and in the upcoming days you will see a lot of youngsters getting crucial responsibilities in the party," Ramesh asserted.

180.title: Druzhba oil pipeline leak looks like an accident: Poland
180.article_body: Poland has said that the detected leak in one of the Druzhba pipelines, that brings oil from Russia to Europe, was probably caused by an accident. Polish operator PERN said that the exact causes of the leak are unknown. The Druzhba oil pipeline supplies Russian oil to European countries including the Czech Republic, Germany, Austria, Poland, Hungary and Slovakia.

181.title: J'khand Dalit youth hung from pole for protesting girl's molestation
181.article_body: A youth from Pachda village in Jharkhand's Hazaribagh was hung from an electric pole after being dragged out of his house and killed for protesting a girl's molestation. The victim's family had earlier tried to lodge a police complaint claiming threat to their life, former Jharkhand CM Babulal Marandi said. The victim is survived by his wife and four children.

182.title: BEST announces Diwali offer, select passengers can avail 5 trips at ₹9
182.article_body: Mumbai's Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) Undertaking on Tuesday announced a Diwali offer to promote digital bus travel. The one-time offer will allow passengers to avail five trips on any route for ₹9 for seven days. It's exclusively for those who are buying a Super Saver plan or a digital ticket on BEST's Chalo app for the first time.

183.title: Russia kidnaps deputy chief of Europe's largest nuclear power plant
183.article_body: Russia has kidnapped a deputy chief of Europe's largest nuclear power plant, the Zaporizhzhia in Ukraine. Valeriy Martynyuk is being detained at an unknown location, Ukraine's state nuclear energy company Energoatom said on Tuesday. Energoatom called on International Atomic Energy Agency Director General Rafael Grossi to take all possible measures to help free Martynyuk.

184.title: Ranveer Singh, Kiara Advani win Maharashtrian of the Year Award 2022
184.article_body: Ranveer Singh and Kiara Advani were honoured at the Lokmat Maharashtrian of the Year 2022 award event in Mumbai on Tuesday. Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde and Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis felicitated the actors. Ranveer, who won the award for the film '83', said, "Whatever I am, I am because of this state and my whole identity is related to it."

185.title: B'luru couple threaten to set themselves on fire, rescued just as woman lights a match
185.article_body: A Bengaluru couple stood in front of a bulldozer, threatening to set themselves on fire if their house is demolished as BBMP continued demolition drive to remove structures illegally blocking the city's drainage. They are seen pouring petrol on themselves when policemen and neighbours pull them up. Water was sprayed on them as they appeared ready to light a match.

186.title: Every day was difficult: Parineeti on filming 'Code Name...' during COVID-19
186.article_body: Parineeti Chopra shared that "every day was difficult" on the sets of 'Code Name: Tiranga', which was shot in Turkey during the second wave of COVID-19. She said the team faced "many challenges" and felt like they were "isolated on an island". However, Parineeti said that the hardships made the whole crew feel like a "big family away from home".

187.title: 2 killed as bike collides with concrete mixer truck in Pune
187.article_body: At least two persons, aged 23 and 19, were killed after the motorbike they were riding was hit by a concrete mixer truck on Pune's Karve Road on Tuesday, police said. The truck driver has been arrested, police added. The bike and truck were moving at a high speed and had a head-on collision, police further said.

188.title: Facebook users complain of losing followers, Zuckerberg's decline by 119 million
188.article_body: Several Facebook users have complained about losing a majority of their followers on the social media platform due to unknown reasons. Notably, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg has also lost over 119 million followers, bringing his follower count to less than 10,000. Meanwhile, a Meta spokesperson said, "We’re working to get things back to normal as quickly as possible."

189.title: Wholesome & cathartic experience: Ananya on 'Kho Gaye Hum Kahan'
189.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday has wrapped up the shooting of her upcoming film 'Kho Gaye Hum Kahan' and called it "the most fulfilling, wholesome, explorative and cathartic" experience. "I didn't know it was possible to love so many people at once, but that's what I felt every single day on set, for every single person associated with this film," she shared.

190.title: Hindi imposition undermines 21 other official languages: CPI MP to PM
190.article_body: In a letter to PM Narendra Modi, CPI Rajya Sabha MP Binoy Viswam has raised objections against the '11th Report of the Committee of Parliament on Official Languages' saying it gives undue prominence to Hindi. "The imposition of Hindi to the exclusion of others is deeply offensive and threatens the importance of the 21 other official languages," he wrote.

191.title: Women pull hair, hit each other during fight in Mumbai local, video viral
191.article_body: A video showing two women fighting inside a local train in Mumbai has gone viral on social media. In the video, the women can be seen shouting, hitting and pulling each other's hair in the crowded compartment of the train. The fight reportedly started following an argument after one of the women alleged that another woman blocked the train's door.

192.title: Russian missiles hit 30% of Ukraine's energy infrastructure in 2 days: Min
192.article_body: Ukraine's Energy Minister German Galushchenko said Russia hit about 30% of the country's energy infrastructure in its missile attacks on October 10 and 11. "We send this message to our partners: we need to protect the sky," Galushchenko told CNN in an interview. He added that Russia "does not care about any kind of international agreements or conventions".

193.title: Sonia Gandhi suggesting my name is rumour: Kharge on Cong chief poll
193.article_body: Congress Presidential poll candidate Mallikarjun Kharge on Tuesday said that party chief Sonia Gandhi suggesting his name for the party's President position "is all a rumour". "I have never said this. She has clearly stated that anyone from the Gandhi family will neither be a part of the election nor support any candidate," Kharge added.

194.title: Delhi sees season's first fog, air quality drops to 'moderate' category
194.article_body: The national capital witnessed this winter season's first fog spell today as visibility fell to 350 metres in parts of Delhi. This is because of the high moisture content in the atmosphere due to continuous rainfall, IMD said. Meanwhile, Delhi's overall air quality index (AQI), which was recorded as 66 (satisfactory) on Tuesday, touched 125 (moderate) on Wednesday.

195.title: Hyderabad  Metro to introduce 25 new routes for last-mile connectivity
195.article_body: Hyderabad Metro Rail and Svida Mobility Services have decided to introduce 25 new routes for last-mile connectivity to nearly 15 residential and commercial hubs in a month's time. The routes will be in the radius of 3-4 km of Begumpet, HITEC City, Paradise, Tarnaka, Parade Ground and Kukatpally. The new routes will use e-autos and Tata wingers for feeder services.

196.title: One victim cut into 56 pieces in Kerala human sacrifice, victims injured in private parts
196.article_body: Police on Wednesday revealed details of the alleged human sacrifice case in Kerala, including that one victim was cut into 56 pieces. Kochi Commissioner CH Nagaraju said Shafi, the main accused, has a criminal past and trapped the couple, Bhagaval Singh and his wife Laila, who made these sacrifices, for money. The victims were also injured in their private parts.

197.title: Washington Sundar brings more to the table than Ashwin: Aakash Chopra
197.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said Washington Sundar "brings more to the table" than Ravichandran Ashwin, but the all-rounder missed the bus for the upcoming T20 World Cup due to recurring injuries. "Had Washington remained...without any injuries in the last 10 months...he'd have been part of the T20 WC squad," stated Aakash. Sundar last played a T20I in March last year.

198.title: 2 Nigerian men fight over woman in Bengaluru, 1 stabbed to death
198.article_body: A Nigerian national was stabbed to death by a fellow countryman in Bengaluru on Sunday evening, following a dispute over a relationship with a woman who was living with one of them. The accused lived with his Indian girlfriend and stabbed the deceased over suspicion of him developing a relationship with her, the police investigation revealed.

199.title: Jet Airways may resume services with 5 aircraft by Oct-end: Report
199.article_body: Jet Airways is planning to resume operations by October-end, after a hiatus of three years and has identified three A320 Neo and two B737-8 MAX aeroplanes for its initial fleet, as per a report. The airline was taken over by a consortium of Murari Lal Jalan, a Dubai-based businessman and Florian Fritsch, the Chairman of London's Kalrock Capital Management Limited.

200.title: Western Railway to generate wind energy with turbines along Mumbai tracks
200.article_body: The Western Railway (WR) has decided to install two wind turbines along tracks near Mumbai's Bhayandar as part of a pilot project to produce energy using the velocity of trains. "WR's Mumbai suburban section witnesses over a thousand train services daily, with a high frequency...This will definitely increase the energy production capacity of the turbines," a WR official said.

201.title: Govt may give OMCs a compensation of ₹20,000 crore for LPG: Report
201.article_body: The government is likely to approve compensation of a little over ₹20,000 crore to state-run oil marketing companies for losses suffered by them due to the unchanged rates of LPG cooking gas,  CNBC-TV18 reported. Following the development, shares of Indian Oil Corporation, Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited and Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited surged on Wednesday.

202.title: Apple to roll out 5G software update in India by December
202.article_body: Apple on Wednesday said that it will start upgrading its software to support 5G services for iPhone users in India by December. In a statement, the company said, "We are working with our carrier partners in India to bring the best 5G experience to iPhone users as soon as network validation and testing for quality and performance is completed."

203.title: Kerala human sacrifice case accused confesses to eating body parts of victims
203.article_body: Kerala Police have revealed the details of the alleged human sacrifice case in which three people were arrested for killing two women for financial gain. Laila, an accused, reportedly confessed that the three accused consumed a portion of the victims' body parts after cooking. "It is being investigated, but not confirmed yet. Prime accused Shafi is a pervert," police said.

204.title: Former Myanmar leader Aung San Suu Kyi gets 3 years in prison for corruption
204.article_body: A court in military-ruled Myanmar has sentenced ousted leader Aung San Suu Kyi to three years in prison on charges of accepting a bribe, reports said. Suu Kyi faces charges for at least 18 offences ranging from corruption to election violations, carrying a combined maximum sentence of 190 years. The ousted leader denied any wrongdoing and called the accusations absurd.

205.title: He doesn't know much about Taiwan: Taiwan Premier on Musk's proposal
205.article_body: Taiwan's Premier Su Tseng-chang in response to Tesla CEO Elon Musk proposing a special administration zone for Taiwan said, "Musk only speaks for himself but he really doesn't know much about Taiwan and he also doesn't understand cross-strait relations." "Musk is a businessman...He has a big car factory in Shanghai and he wants to promote his electric vehicles," he added.

206.title: Punjab and Haryana HC quashes FIRs against Tajinder Bagga, Kumar Vishvas
206.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has quashed the FIRs filed by Punjab Police against former AAP leader and poet Kumar Vishvas and BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga. Vishvas had purportedly made inflammatory statements against AAP National Convener Arvind Kejriwal alleging links with separatist elements. Bagga was booked for posting "fabricated and communally divisive statements" against Kejriwal.

207.title: 25-year-old school teacher gets 3-year jail term for stalking minor girl in Hyd
207.article_body: A POCSO court awarded a three-year jail term to a 25-year-old school teacher for stalking a minor girl in Hyderabad. The teacher, Yacharam Ramesh, went to the 17-year-old girl's house and threatened her saying he will die if she didn't marry him. Despite receiving a warning from her, the man continued to harass her over calls and messages.

208.title: Russia detains 8 suspects over Crimea bridge blast; blames Ukraine
208.article_body: Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) said it has detained five Russians and three citizens of Ukraine and Armenia over Saturday's explosion that damaged a key bridge linking Crimea to Russia. The "terrorist attack" was organised by Ukrainian secret services, FSB added. The explosives used in the attack were sent from Ukraine's Odesa through Bulgaria, Georgia and Armenia, FSB further said.

209.title: 7 family members injured in LPG cylinder blast in Haryana's Rohtak
209.article_body: Seven members of a family, including a married couple and five children, were critically injured in an LPG cylinder blast in Haryana's Rohtak on Wednesday. Their house was also damaged in the incident. "All family members were admitted to the hospital. Fire tenders and police reached the spot," said Samsher Singh, Inspector, Shivaji Colony Police Station.

210.title: Not true: 'Taarak Mehta...' fame Disha's brother on reports she has throat cancer
210.article_body: The brother of actress Disha Vakani, known for playing Dayaben in television show 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', has dismissed reports claiming that she is suffering from throat cancer. "These kind of rumours keep doing the rounds in the media and there is no truth to it," her brother Mayur said.

211.title: ICC names 2 strike bowlers for every team at T20 World Cup 2022
211.article_body: ICC has named two strike bowlers for every team at T20 World Cup 2022, considering their rankings and the latest form. For India, ICC named pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar and leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal as the strike bowling combination. For Pakistan, ICC chose pacers Mohammad Wasim and Haris Rauf. Meanwhile, ICC named Josh Hazlewood and Adam Zampa as hosts Australia's strike bowlers.

212.title: Suryakumar reminds me of ABD, he's the player to watch out for in WC: Steyn
212.article_body: Ex-South Africa pacer Dale Steyn has said India's Suryakumar Yadav is in "red-hot form" and he's the player to watch out for in the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia. "He's a wonderful 360-degree player, and reminds me of AB de Villiers," added Steyn. Suryakumar has scored three fifties in his last four T20I innings.

213.title: Army dog who was shot twice in J&K stable after surgery, next 24 hours critical: Official
213.article_body: Army dog Zoom, who received two gunshot injuries while fighting terrorists in Anantnag in J&K, is stable after a surgery was performed on him, said officials. "His fractured rear leg was plastered and splinter injuries on his face were treated. The next 24-48 hours are critical and he is under close observation at Army Veterinary Hospital in Srinagar," officials added.

214.title: Former US Presidential candidate Tulsi announces exit from Democratic Party
214.article_body: Former US Presidential candidate Tulsi Gabbard took to social media to announce her exit from the Democratic Party. "I can no longer remain in today's Democratic Party that is now under the complete control of an elitist cabal of warmongers," she wrote. "The Democratic Party stands for a government of, by, and for the powerful elite," she added.

215.title: Don't think anyone will come close to her stardom: Janhvi on Sridevi
215.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said she doesn't think "anyone will come close" to her mother Sridevi's stardom. Janhvi said she got "a sense" of the late actress' popularity when she saw "people speaking so passionately about her films, performances, and the kind of person she was on set". She added that Sridevi's stardom is "rare" and happens "once in a lifetime".

216.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face scheduled power cuts this week
216.article_body: Some parts of Bengaluru will face power cuts from October 12 to October 15 as Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) and Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation Limited (KPTCL) will be undertaking some maintenance works. Most of these outages might occur between 10 am and 4 pm. KPTCL divisions which will remain affected today are - Somanahalli, Channagiri and Chitradurga.

217.title: 2 labourers killed, 3 injured after building roof collapses in Bengaluru
217.article_body: At least two labourers were killed and three others were injured after the roof of a building collapsed in Mahadevapura in Karnataka's Bengaluru. "While the incident happened at 5:30 am on Tuesday, it came to light only when other workers went to the site," police said. "Since it was raining heavily, they slept on the ground floor," police added.

218.title: World's richest person Musk launches 'Burnt Hair' perfume priced at $100
218.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk has announced a new business venture, a 'Burnt Hair' perfume under his brand The Boring Company. The perfume is priced at $100 (around ₹8,000). Changing his Twitter bio to 'Perfume Salesman', Musk tweeted, "With a name like mine, getting into the fragrance business was inevitable...Why did I even fight it for so long!?"

219.title: China observing war in Ukraine to develop 'hybrid warfare': Taiwan
219.article_body: China is looking at Ukraine war to develop "hybrid warfare" strategies against Taiwan like usage of drones and psychological pressure, Taiwanese security official, Chen Ming-tong, said. "Taiwan will take responsibility for our own self-defence," President Tsai Ing-wen recently said. In August, China conducted military drills around Taiwan after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited island nation.

220.title: Ponniyin Selvan's success means people will see its sequel: Karthi
220.article_body: Tamil actor Karthi said the success of 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One' means that the "anticipation for part two would be naturally even more and people will come and see it". The actor said he's happy about the film's box office success and called 2022 a "good year for Tamil cinema". On Tuesday, the film crossed ₹400 crore worldwide.

221.title: No automaticity that Bharat Jodo Yatra will translate into poll success: Jairam
221.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh while speaking about the Bharat Jodo Yatra said there is no automaticity that this yatra will translate into electoral success. Hindustan Times quoted Ramesh as saying, "This isn't a yatra to win elections but it's a political yatra...for mass awareness, mass mobilisation." "Now that has to be accompanied by political strategy and organisational changes," he added.

222.title: Armyman dies, 8 injured as bus rams into truck on Yamuna Expressway in UP
222.article_body: A man, who was an Indian Army sepoy and was posted with the Dogra Regiment, was killed and eight others were injured as a bus rammed into a stationary truck on Yamuna Expressway in Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddha Nagar, police said. "The injured were taken out of the bus after cutting the vehicle with a gas cutter," police stated.

223.title: Amit Shah not old enough to comment on JP: Nitish Kumar
223.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said Union Minister Amit Shah doesn't have the age or experience to comment on Lok Nayak Jayaprakash Narayan. "[Shah] wants to speak about the JP movement which took place in 1974. What does he know about it? How old is he?" said Kumar. The remarks come after Shah said Kumar betrayed JP by siding with Congress.

224.title: Which are the top 10 universities according to THE World University Rankings 2023?
224.article_body: The University of Oxford has topped the Times Higher Education World University Rankings 2023, which include 1,799 universities across 104 countries and regions. The Harvard University is placed second, while the University of Cambridge and the Stanford University ranked third. The next on the list are MIT, Caltech, Princeton, University of California, Yale University and Imperial College London.

225.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
225.article_body: IMD has said heavy rainfall spell will likely continue over Tamil Nadu during next 5 days and over Karnataka and Andhra Pradesh during next 2 days. It added that fairly widespread/widespread light/moderate rainfall with isolated heavy falls is very likely over Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland and Manipur. Very heavy rainfall is expected in West Bengal and Sikkim.

226.title: Tracxn﻿ Technologies' IPO subscribed 81% on final day of issue
226.article_body: The initial public offering of Tracxn Technologies, a Bengaluru-based market data startup, was subscribed 81% by 12 pm on Wednesday. Investors have bought 1.72 crore equity shares against 2.12 crore on offer, so far, with retail investors buying 3.24 times the allotted size and non-institutional investors subscribing 38%. Qualified institutional investors have bought 22% shares allotted to them.

227.title: Haryana stops Maiden Pharma cough syrup production, issues notice with 12 violations
227.article_body: Haryana has stopped the production of cough syrups at Maiden Pharmaceuticals after the company came under scrutiny over cough syrup-linked deaths of 66 children in Gambia. Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij confirmed this and said serious lapses were found from an inspection carried out at their unit in Sonepat. A show cause listing 12 contraventions was issued to the company.

228.title: I can beat Donald Trump again in 2024: US Prez Joe Biden
228.article_body: US President Joe Biden said he believes he could beat his predecessor Donald Trump again in 2024. When asked about what he would tell voters who consider him too old for re-election, Biden said, "Name me a President in recent history that's gotten as much done as I've in the first two years." Biden is the oldest US President.

229.title: 'Chhello Show' makers to set up trust fund in memory of Rahul Koli: Report
229.article_body: The makers of 'Chhello Show' will reportedly set up a trust fund in memory of late child actor Rahul Koli, who passed away on October 2. "Through the fund, his family will get a monthly sum, and it'll work towards helping other kids in the treatment for blood cancer and bone marrow transplant," a source told Hindustan Times.

230.title: PM Modi has changed corruption culture in arms deal: JP Nadda
230.article_body: Earlier, corruption was synonymous with arms deal but PM Narendra Modi has "changed this culture", BJP National President JP Nadda said on Tuesday. While addressing a gathering in Himachal Pradesh’s Bilaspur, Nadda said that India earlier used to purchase arms and there used to be several scams in such deals but now, the country is selling arms to the world.

231.title: Delhi man pretends to be Spanish actor on Instagram to trap girls
231.article_body: A Delhi man created an Instagram account in the name of Spanish actor Manu Rios to befriend girls and blackmail them later, said police. The complainant said she shared her private pictures with the accused, 22-year-old Abbuzar Rehman, who had befriended her while pretending to be Rios. He then demanded money, threatening to make her pictures viral on social media.

232.title: It's like having the best car, but you leave it in garage: Lee on Umran Malik
232.article_body: Former Australia pacer Brett Lee has said India's 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik should've been selected in India's squad for the T20 World Cup in Australia. "Umran Malik is bowling at 150 kmph. I mean when you have the best car in the world, and you leave it in the garage, then what's the point of having that car?" said Lee.

233.title: PM Modi to inaugurate 4th Vande Bharat Express in HP's Una tomorrow
233.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the fourth Vande Bharat Express train in Himachal Pradesh's Una district tomorrow (October 13). The train will be operating between Delhi and Himachal Pradesh, railways officials said. The train, with 16 coaches, will run six days a week except on Wednesdays. It will have halts in Ambala, Chandigarh, Anandpur Sahib and Una.

234.title: 51 dengue cases in October so far in Pune, more cases likely: PMC
234.article_body: Pune has witnessed 51 positive dengue cases this month till October 10 in the city limits, Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) said. "As the rainfall in the city is likely to increase, there is a chance that dengue cases will also see a rise this month," an official said. Notably, Pune recorded 121 positive dengue cases in September.

235.title: Will strictly enforce cracker ban in Gurugram, only green crackers allowed: DC
235.article_body: Gurugram Deputy Commissioner (DC) Nishant Kumar Yadav said that only green crackers are allowed for manufacture, use and sale in Haryana according to the orders of the National Green Tribunal (NGT) and Haryana State Pollution Control Board (HSPCB). He further added that the restriction will continue till further orders and it will be strictly enforced in the district.

236.title: You introduced me to the actor in me: Abhishek to Amitabh Bachchan
236.article_body: On Amitabh Bachchan's birthday special episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14', Abhishek Bachchan shared that his father was the one who introduced him to the actor in him. He said the veteran actor taught him that there's "nothing more powerful than your work, nothing more valuable than people's love and nothing is beyond family". Amitabh turned 80 on October 11.

237.title: ₹17.49 cr released to construct 583 classrooms in schools: Punjab minister
237.article_body: Punjab Minister of School Education Harjot Singh Bains said that the first instalment of ₹17.49 crore has been released for the construction of 583 classrooms in government schools in 17 districts. He added that ₹1.94 crore has been released for the purchase of furniture for 334 classrooms. Bains stated that the classrooms are being constructed with the support of NABARD.

238.title: Robot addresses UK Parliament, says 'Although not alive, I can still create art'
238.article_body: A 'robot artist' called Ai-Da interacted with British lawmakers on Tuesday, speaking at a parliamentary inquiry into how new technologies will affect the creative industries. "I am, and depend on, computer programmes and algorithms. Although not alive, I can still create art," Ai-Da said. Ai-Da was created by scientists at the University of Oxford.

239.title: MiG-29K fighter aircraft crashes during sortie over sea off Goa coast; pilot ejects safely
239.article_body: The Indian Navy has said that a MiG-29K fighter aircraft crashed during a routine sortie over sea off Goa coast after it developed a technical malfunction while returning to base. "Pilot ejected safely and was recovered in a swift search and rescue operation. Pilot is reported to be in a stable condition," the Navy added.

240.title: Zelenskyy asks G7 to help Ukraine with 'air shield' after Russian strikes
240.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday appealed to leaders of Group of Seven (G7) countries to help Kyiv establish an "air shield" following Russian strikes on a number of Ukrainian cities. Zelenskyy said "millions of people would be grateful" for the shield. He added that Russia "still has room for further escalation" beyond Monday's missile strikes that killed several civilians.

241.title: Maiden pharma didn't perform quality testing in cough syrup: Notice
241.article_body: Maiden Pharmaceuticals, which was flagged by the WHO following the death of 66 children in Gambia, didn't perform quality testing of a raw material used in the manufacture of one of the medicines, according to Haryana drug controller's show cause notice. The notice listed 12 points of contraventions which were detected during the inspection of the company's Sonepat unit.

242.title: Rape threats sent to DCW chief Swati over her letter on Sajid's ouster from Bigg Boss
242.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women's (DCW) chief Swati Maliwal has said she has been receiving rape threats over her letter to I&B Minister Anurag Thakur demanding the ouster of filmmaker Sajid Khan from Bigg Boss over allegations of sexual harassment levelled against him. Maliwal shared screenshots of the threats she received and said she's filing a complaint with the Delhi Police.

243.title: Defence staffer cheats Pune woman of ₹6 lakh on pretext of giving job
243.article_body: A defence staffer and his accomplice have been booked in Pune for allegedly cheating a woman of ₹6 lakh on pretext of giving her a job in Indian Railways. The accused allegedly demanded ₹18 lakh initially but the victim could only pay ₹8 lakh. After she didn't get the job, she demanded her money back but only got ₹2 lakh.

244.title: 74-year-old Mumbai man, who was injured in lift accident, dies
244.article_body: A 74-year-old man, who was hospitalised after a lift accident in his residential complex in Mumbai's Borivali days ago, succumbed to his injuries on Tuesday. According to police, when the victim entered the elevator on the first floor, its door closed abruptly and it hit the ground. The victim suffered injuries on his hand, chest and shoulder.

245.title: UK businessman charged with helping Russian oligarch evade US sanctions
245.article_body: British businessman Graham Bonham-Carter was arrested in UK after being charged by US authorities for helping a Russian oligarch evade sanctions. The US has accused Bonham-Carter of funding properties purchased by oligarch Oleg Deripaska and also trying to move the aluminium magnate's artwork in the US overseas. Bonham-Carter has been released on bail. US imposed sanctions on Deripaska in 2018.

246.title: Biden pledges ‘consequences’ for Saudi Arabia after OPEC+ decision on oil
246.article_body: US President Joe Biden has pledged "consequences" for Saudi Arabia after Riyadh-led coalition of oil-producing nations, OPEC+, decided to cut oil production by two million barrels a day from November. Biden gave the statement to CNN a day after Senate Foreign Relations Committee Chairperson, Bob Menendez, said the US must immediately freeze all cooperation with Saudi Arabia, including arms sales.

247.title: I'd go for Siraj, he has been bowling well: Gavaskar on Bumrah's replacement
247.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said he would go for pacer Mohammed Siraj as Jasprit Bumrah's replacement in the upcoming T20 World Cup as the 28-year-old has been "bowling well". "Mohammad Shami has played no cricket. And that's a concern," added Gavaskar. Siraj was named the 'Player of the Series' in the recently-concluded three-match ODI series against South Africa.

248.title: Kerala CM opposes proposal to make Hindi medium of instruction in IITs, IIMs
248.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Tuesday opposed a Parliamentary panel proposal to make Hindi the medium of instruction in all higher educational institutions like IITs and IIMs in Hindi-speaking states. "The essence of India is defined by the concept of 'unity in diversity'...Promoting any one language above others would destroy integrity," Vijayan wrote in a letter to PM Narendra Modi.

249.title: BJP govt carried out 'surgery' to change old system in Guj: PM Modi
249.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said Gujarat was afflicted by many diseases earlier and his government carried out a "surgery" to change the old system. "Twenty or twenty-five years ago, many diseases had afflicted Gujarat," he said while listing problems such as backwardness in healthcare, lack of electricity and water, poor law and order situation and misgovernance.

250.title: Water meters to be installed in Noida's housing societies soon
250.article_body: The Noida authority said it will install water meters in all housing societies to regulate water usage and charge tariffs as per consumption. "We aim to install them in 370 housing societies by the end of this month," said an official. The authority has already installed around 400 water meters in individual houses in Sector 19 and 27, reports said.

251.title: Adani Data Networks gets licence to offer telecom services in India: Report
251.article_body: Adani Data Networks has reportedly been granted a unified licence to offer telecom services in India. The company bought a 400MHz spectrum in the 26GHz millimetre wave band for ₹212 crore for 20 years in the recent 5G spectrum auction. Earlier, Adani Group clarified that it doesn't intend to enter the consumer mobility space with its 5G spectrum.

252.title: Marvel delays 'Deadpool 3', 'Avengers…', 'Blade' & 'Fantastic Four' release
252.article_body: Marvel Studios said they're postponing release of their upcoming projects, including 'Avengers: Secret Wars', 'Blade', 'Fantastic Four' and 'Deadpool 3'. 'Avengers: Secret Wars', which was looking at November 2025 release, will now release on May 1, 2026. Blade's release has been moved to September 2024 from November 2023, while 'Deadpool 3' will now release in November of 2024.

253.title: Amazing he's trying something new: Janhvi on Boney Kapoor's acting debut
253.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor recently spoke about her father Boney Kapoor's acting debut and said she finds it "amazing that he got to try his hand at something new at this age". The producer will be seen in Luv Ranjan's upcoming untitled film, which stars Ranbir Kapoor and Shraddha Kapoor. Janhvi's sister Khushi Kapoor is also making her Bollywood debut.

254.title: CSMT heritage building illuminated in pink on International Day of Girl Child
254.article_body: The Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) heritage building was illuminated in pink on the occasion of International Day of Girl Child, celebrated on October 11 every year. Taking to social media, the Central Railway shared a picture of the CSMT heritage building and said, "Let's pledge to empower, educate and encourage every girl child."

255.title: Badshah dating Punjabi actress Isha Rikhi: Report
255.article_body: Rapper-singer Badshah is dating Punjabi actress Isha Rikhi from Chandigarh, according to a report. "It's been a year that rapper is seeing a Punjabi actress. Badshah met Isha Rikhi at a party of their common friend...Badshah and Isha have already told about their relationship to their respective families," Pinkvilla reported quoting a source close to Badshah.

256.title: Aus will suit our pacers a lot better: Boucher after SA's series loss vs India
256.article_body: After losing both the ODI and the T20I series in India, South Africa head coach Mark Boucher said Australian pitches will suit their pacers a "lot better". He added, "We have got some good pace, some good bounce in our attack, so we need to keep the aggression there." South Africa lost the three-match ODI series 1-2.

257.title: Jewellery worth ₹7.25 lakh stolen from Pune woman's bag
257.article_body: Gold jewellery worth ₹7.25 lakh was stolen from a 57-year-old woman's bag at Raviwar Peth in Pune on Saturday, said police. The victim said she was carrying the jewellery items to sell but found them missing as she went from one shop to another. She said she was unaware when the valuables were stolen, according to police.

258.title: Corporate Affairs Ministry approves NMDC Steel, NMDC demerger
258.article_body: The Ministry of Corporate Affairs approved the demerger of NMDC Steel from the government-owned miner NMDC. On Tuesday, NMDC said it was in the process of complying with the requirements as envisaged in the ministry's order. NMDC had floated NMDC Steel in January 2015 for the manufacture and trade of stainless steel, silicon, special steel and other allied inputs.

259.title: TCS staff seeking WFH on medical grounds referred to firm's doctors for validation: Report
259.article_body: TCS employees seeking exemption from work from office on medical basis are reportedly being referred to doctors empanelled by the company for validation. According to a report, employees have been asked to get their records of diagnosis and medical certificates validated by these doctors to permit remote work. TCS staff has been asked to work from office thrice a week.

260.title: India reports 2,139 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 26,292
260.article_body: India reported 2,139 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The number of active COVID-19 cases in the country dropped to 26,292 from the earlier 27,374, as per the ministry. The coronavirus-related death toll so far has reached 5,28,835. The daily positivity rate stood at 0.81%.

261.title: 80% excess rain in 1st 10 days of post-monsoon season in India: IMD
261.article_body: India witnessed 80% excess rain in the first 10 days of the "post-monsoon" season from October 1 to 10, India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. Delhi recorded 625%, Uttar Pradesh 698% and Haryana 577% excess rainfall in the first 10 days of October. Monsoon withdrawal from Delhi was announced but the withdrawal line was still passing over the region, IMD stated.

262.title: Pant should be worried, Ishan Kishan is coming for his spot: Steyn
262.article_body: Ex-South Africa pacer Dale Steyn has praised batter Ishan Kishan, stating that wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant should be "worried that someone (Ishan) is coming for his spot". "I've watched Ishan go and get better. For a short and small man, he packs an incredible punch," added Steyn. Ishan scored 20, 93 and 10 in his three innings in the SA ODIs.

263.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra nothing but an event to relaunch Rahul: K'taka CM
263.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said that Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra is nothing but an event to relaunch Rahul Gandhi by the party. "The Congress leaders are ready to do anything for the sake of power. Rahul Gandhi has been doing padayatra to be relevant in the current political situation," he added.

264.title: Hyderabad bar raided for playing loud music, 7 arrested
264.article_body: Hyderabad's Air Live bar and restaurant, located at Sarath City Capital mall, was raided by police for playing loud music. The police arrested seven people including managers, singers and keyboard players, and also seized their sound systems and speakers. The bar was disturbing public peace and violating orders of the Telangana High Court, the police officials said.

265.title: Unhygienic & almost medieval: Harvey Weinstein's lawyer on his cell condition
265.article_body: Former film producer Harvey Weinstein's attorney Mark Werksman told judge at sexual assault trial that conditions of the cell where his client is kept are "unhygienic" and "almost medieval". "He's 70 years old. I'm worried about him surviving this ordeal without a heart attack or stroke," Werksman added. Weinstein is facing trial on 11 counts of rape and sexual assault.

266.title: UK King Charles' coronation to take place in May 2023
266.article_body: Buckingham Palace on Tuesday announced that King Charles III will be crowned at Westminster Abbey on May 6 next year. Camilla, the Queen Consort, will be crowned alongside her husband. Charles immediately became King when Queen Elizabeth II died on September 8. He also took over as head of state of 14 Commonwealth countries, including Australia, Canada and New Zealand.

267.title: People residing in Jammu for over 1 year can register as voters: Government
267.article_body: The Deputy Commissioner of Jammu has passed an order authorising all tehsildars (revenue officials) to issue certificates of residence to those who have lived in the district for more than one year. The decision was taken to ensure that no eligible voter is left for registration in the ongoing special summary revision of electoral rolls in J&K, the order stated.

268.title: India in talks with nations to make RuPay acceptable, UPI, BHIM being reworked: Sitharaman
268.article_body: India is talking to different countries to make RuPay acceptable in their nations, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Tuesday. "Not just that, the UPI, the BHIM app, and NPCI are all now being worked in such a way that their systems in their respective country, however, robust or otherwise, can talk to our system," she added.

269.title: Homeless man masturbates in front of woman in Mumbai, goes to jail
269.article_body: A 32-year-old homeless man was sentenced to six months jail by a Mumbai court after just two days of trial for insulting the modesty of a 23-year-old woman. According to the victim, she was out for a walk with her dog along the Kennedy Bridge when the man made lewd gestures and then started masturbating in front of her.

270.title: Asteroid's path altered after NASA deliberately crashes spacecraft into it
270.article_body: The spacecraft which NASA deliberately crashed into an asteroid last month succeeded in nudging the rocky moonlet from its natural path into a faster orbit, marking the first time humanity has altered motion of a celestial body. The DART mission also represented world's first test of a planetary defense system designed to prevent a potential doomsday meteorite collision with Earth.

271.title: Ankita Lokhande joins Randeep Hooda's 'Swatantra Veer Savarkar'
271.article_body: Actress Ankita Lokhande has been cast as the female lead of Randeep Hooda's 'Swatantra Veer Savarkar'. Confirming the news, Ankita said she loves to play "challenging and pivotal characters" that leave an impact on audience. "'Swatantra Veer Savarkar' is one such inspiring story that needs to be told and I'm happy to be associated with it," she added.

272.title: Biker beaten up for honking horn in Pune, admitted to hospital
272.article_body: A 23-year-old Pune resident was allegedly beaten up by a group of three people for honking his motorcycle's horn to clear his way. He was injured and admitted to a hospital. According to police, the victim, who was with a friend, got into a heated argument with three persons, who asked him to stop honking. A case has been filed.

273.title: Should support every Indian film for Oscar: 'Chhello Show' producer on 'RRR'
273.article_body: 'Chhello Show' producer Siddharth Roy Kapur said people "should support every Indian film" that's running for Oscars. Siddharth's statement has come in response to RRR's Oscar submission under 14 categories, including Best Director. "If more films are representing India, it increases our chances of bringing the Oscar back home, or at least, of bringing a nomination back home," he said.

274.title: Either 'jumla' or 'hamla', this is double engine govt PM talks about: KTR
274.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Tuesday said PM Narendra Modi means "either jumla or hamla" when he talks about the double engine government. "If anyone is vocal like TRS, CM KCR, the Centre uses CBI, ED, IT and other agencies," he added. "By threatening, they will try to control," Rao stated.

275.title: Remains of 240 people, including kids, found under department store in UK
275.article_body: Remains of more than 240 people, including kids, have been unearthed by archaeologists working on the remnants of a medieval monastery found beneath a former department store. The discovery was made under the old Ocky White building in Haverfordwest, Pembrokeshire. According to archaeologists, the ruins are from St Saviour's Priory, founded by a Dominican order of monks in about 1256.

276.title: Man City, Real Madrid enter Champions League knockouts; Chelsea stun Milan
276.article_body: Manchester City and Real Madrid have become the first teams to enter the knockout phase of the ongoing Champions League after playing out draws in their respective matches on Tuesday night. City were held to a 0-0 draw by Copenhagen, while Madrid rescued a 1-1 draw in the last five minutes against Shakhtar Donetsk. Meanwhile, Chelsea defeated AC Milan 2-0.

277.title: 2-seater Chinese electric flying car makes 1st public test flight in Dubai, pics surface
277.article_body: An electric flying car built by the Chinese electronic vehicle maker Xpeng made its first public test flight in Dubai. Powered by eight propellers, the vehicle can carry two passengers and as per the company, it has a top speed of 130 km per hour. Several pictures and videos of the test flight also surfaced on social media.

278.title: 'Djinn' stole ₹41 lakh, believes Mumbai family; turns out inside job
278.article_body: The family of a Mumbai-based businessman reportedly lost ₹40.98 lakh in cash and jewellery in a series of thefts from their house. However, they were reluctant to file a case as they believed it was the work of a 'Djinn'. The police found out a 13-year-old girl, daughter of the businessman's sister, was stealing for her brother in Surat.

279.title: Several areas of Gurugram to face 3.5-hour-long power cut today
279.article_body: Eleven areas in Gurugram, including some housing commercial buildings, would face a 3.5-hour-long power cut from 9.30 am to 1 pm today. The decision of the planned power outage is taken because the Haryana Vidyut Prasaran Nigam Limited (HVPNL) will carry out annual maintenance work on one of its 66kV substations in DLF Block Q, power officials said.

280.title: Revenue official arrested for taking ₹4,000 bribe from farmer in Pune
280.article_body: Anti-Corruption Bureau officials in Pune arrested a revenue assistant for allegedly taking a bribe of ₹4,000 from a farmer to change the occupancy grade of the land allotted to him. The accused was allegedly demanding the bribe for executing an order that would change the grade, following which the farmer would be able to sell the land without government consent.

281.title: Almost every country slowing, India a bright spot compared to others: IMF
281.article_body: When everyone is slowing down in terms of economic growth, India has not remained unimpacted, but is doing better and is in a relatively bright spot, IMF Director of Asia and Pacific Department, Krishna Srinivasan, has said. The IMF in its World Economic Outlook projected a growth rate of 6.8% in 2022 as compared to 8.7% in 2021 for India.

282.title: Several buildings in Bengaluru's KR Puram, Whitefield demolished
282.article_body: Several encroachments on stormwater drains in Mahadevapura's KR Puram and Whitefield areas were bulldozed by the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) on Tuesday as the civic body restarted anti-encroachment drives in the city. Concrete slabs, parts of compound walls and residential buildings were demolished in SR Layout in KR Puram. A compound wall near Sheelavanthakere Lake was also removed.

283.title: Intel plans to cut thousands of jobs amid PC market slowdown: Report
283.article_body: Chipmaker Intel is planning to cut thousands of jobs amid a slowdown in the personal computer market, as per a report. The job cuts will reportedly be announced as early as this month and may include employees from the sales and marketing divisions. Intel last made significant job cuts in 2016, when about 12,000 people were laid off.

284.title: What is a 'biscuit' in US' nuclear weapons launch process?
284.article_body: A "biscuit" contains the codes, known as Gold Codes, by which the US President can identify himself and authorise the use of nuclear weapons. A biscuit is about the size of a credit card. Recently, US President Joe Biden said the risk of nuclear 'Armageddon' is at the highest level since the 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis.

285.title: 21-yr-old man killed over using public toilet in Delhi, 2 brothers held
285.article_body: A 21-year-old man was killed following an argument with two brothers over using a public toilet in Delhi's Ashok Vihar area, police said. The accused have been arrested, police added. "The victim was previously involved in criminal cases...had threatened the two brothers with a surgical blade, after which they thrashed him...caused injuries to his head and chest," police stated.

286.title: Delhi records 97 fresh COVID-19 cases, 1 death in 24 hours
286.article_body: Delhi reported 97 new cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 1.41% in the last 24 hours, the city health department informed on Tuesday. One death due to the infection was also recorded in the national capital. The city's active case count stood at 420, according to the daily COVID-19 bulletin. Delhi's total case tally has climbed to 20,04,284.

287.title: TN Guv speaking like 'RSS man': DMK on 'Dravidian identity' remark
287.article_body: The DMK said that the Tamil Nadu governor RN Ravi spoke like an 'RSS man' after he said that the concept of Dravidian has become Tamil identity due to politics of division. AIADMK echoed the Governor's sentiments and said that Dravidian geographically includes five states in southern India. "The Governor's remark does not merit attention", a senior DMK leader said.

288.title: Maharashtra logs 384 COVID-19 cases, four deaths in 24 hours
288.article_body: Maharashtra recorded 384 new cases of COVID-19 along with four deaths due to the infection in the last 24 hours, the state health department informed on Tuesday. Satara, Hingoli and Bhandara districts and Pune city logged one fatality each. Out of the fresh cases, 129 were reported from the state capital, Mumbai. Maharashtra's active case count stood at 2,387.

289.title: Railways plans to replace fuel-based vehicles with electric vehicles by 2025
289.article_body: As Centre plans to make India a 100% electric vehicle nation by 2030, the railways have floated a policy to replace its fuel-based vehicles, including those running on diesel, biofuels or natural gas, with electric vehicles by December 2025. A vast charging infrastructure would also be set up at major railway stations, office buildings and parking lots under the policy.

290.title: Want more compensation for Bhopal gas tragedy victims: Govt to SC
290.article_body: The Centre has told the Supreme Court that it wants to pursue a curative petition to provide additional compensation to victims of the 1984 Bhopal gas tragedy. As per the petition, the Centre is seeking ₹7,400 crore as an additional fund from successors of US-based Union Carbide. The Supreme Court posted the matter for hearing on January 10, 2023.

291.title: NATO to hold nuclear exercises next week despite Russian threats
291.article_body: Secretary-General of NATO Jens Stoltenberg on Tuesday said the military alliance will carry on with its nuclear exercises, dubbed "Steadfast Noon", next week, despite threats from Russian President Vladimir Putin. The exercise is held annually and goes on for about a week. The exercise involves fighter jets which can carry nuclear warheads, however, no live bombs are involved.

292.title: Former Pak PM Imran Khan booked for receiving 'prohibited funds'
292.article_body: Ousted Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan has been booked by the country's Federal Investigation Agency for allegedly receiving prohibited foreign funds. According to the FIR, the owner of Wooton Cricket Limited transferred "ill-gotten" funds to a bank account under Khan's party Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf. The party leaders are accused of violating the Foreign Exchange Act.

293.title: RBI modifies guidelines to manage forex exposure during volatility
293.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) modified guidelines for banks to manage foreign currency exposure in times of forex volatility. The RBI said that banks have to provide a 25 percentage point increase in risk weight, if potential exposure from an entity's unhedged foreign currency exposure is over 75%. The RBI asked banks to ascertain the exposure annually at least.

294.title: Will try to win remaining races: Verstappen after winning world title
294.article_body: 2022 F1 world champion Max Verstappen said he will "definitely try" to win the remaining four races of the season. "There is no real pressure anymore but I still want to of course try and win more," said Verstappen. He added that he wanted to extend the current advantage as it may not be there "in the years to come".

295.title: Scientists discover new function of human brain's cerebellum
295.article_body: The primary function of the human brain's cerebellum is the regulation of movement. But scientists have recently discovered that the cerebellum also plays an important role in remembering emotional experiences. In the study that involved 1,418 participants, researchers found that the cerebellum showed an increase in brain activity of the participants while remembering positive and negative images.

296.title: Govt may give IDBI buyer free hand in running bank: Report
296.article_body: The government may offer the potential buyer, in the share purchase agreement of IDBI Bank, a free hand in running the bank. A government official said that they don't want to be a hindrance in the bank's functioning after the management control is passed to the buyer. The Centre and LIC are divesting 60.72% stake in IDBI Bank.

297.title: Mbappe seeking Jan transfer after feeling 'betrayed' by PSG: Report
297.article_body: PSG forward Kylian Mbappe is reportedly unhappy with the club and is looking for a transfer during the January window. Mbappe is said to be feeling "betrayed" as promises like a second striker alongside him and a new centre-back have not been fulfilled by the club. The forward's relationship with fellow striker Neymar is also said to be an issue.

298.title: If not reformed, UNSC will become irrelevant: S Jaishankar
298.article_body: The United Nations Security Council (UNSC) will become "irrelevant" if it is not reformed, said External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday. India has long demanded the Security Council be reformed and has also demanded a permanent seat in the UNSC. "Well, it's a hard nut but hard nuts can be cracked," said Jaishankar when asked about reforming the UNSC.

299.title: CCI directs 8 firms to cease and desist from unfair business practices
299.article_body: The Competition Commission of India directed eight firms and some of their officials to cease and desist from unfair business practices. CCI alleged the firms quoted identical bids in the tender floated for axle bearings which are used for certain railway coaches. The entities include Krishna Engineering Works, Chandra Brothers, Rama Engineering Works and Sriguru Melters & Engineers, among others.

300.title: India players dance to 'Bolo Ta Ra Ra' in dressing room after win, Dhawan shares video
300.article_body: Team India players danced to Daler Mehndi's song 'Bolo Ta Ra Ra' after winning the three-match ODI series against South Africa on Tuesday. Sharing the video, Shikhar Dhawan, who led the team in the series, wrote, "Jeet ke bolo Tara ra ra." Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "POV: When Shikhar bhai is captain."

301.title: FA to employ lip reader for Henderson-Gabriel altercation probe: Report
301.article_body: The Football Association (FA) is reportedly set to employ a lip reader as part of their ongoing investigation into the altercation between Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson and Arsenal defender Gabriel. The incident took place when the two teams played against each other and a penalty was awarded to Arsenal. The FA started its investigation based on referee Michael Oliver's report.

302.title: Goa to face loss of ₹500 cr if visa curbs to UK not relaxed: GFP MLA
302.article_body: Goa Forward Party (GFP) President and MLA Vijai Sardesai has claimed that Goa will face a loss of ₹500 crore if tourists from the UK don't visit the state due to visa restrictions. He appealed to the BJP government to relax the restrictions. Sardesai claimed a minimum of 40,000-50,000 tourists, who spend ₹98,000 each, visit Goa from the UK annually.

303.title: Mahakal Corridor scheme formed under Kamal Nath: Congress
303.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh Congress has alleged that the scheme for the development and extension of Ujjain's Mahakaleshwar Temple was prepared under the rule of Kamal Nath in 2019. State Home Minister Narottam Mishra has denied these claims and said that Kamal Nath 'has a habit of lying'. Mishra added that the proposal for the scheme was prepared in 2017.

304.title: 44 Syrian migrants found inside truck in North Macedonia
304.article_body: Police in North Macedonia have detained 44 Syrian migrants, including 14 minors, who were discovered hiding inside a truck near the southern border with Greece, authorities said on Tuesday. The truck driver was arrested on suspicion of having links with a migrant-smuggling ring. The migrants were found inside a specially-constructed hiding place within the truck, as per local authorities.

305.title: DoT, MeitY to hold meeting with smartphone firms, telcos to resolve 5G issues
305.article_body: Top officials of the Department of Telecom (DoT) and IT ministry have called a joint meeting of smartphone companies, including Apple and Samsung, and telecom operators to ensure smooth rollout of 5G, including smooth onboarding of customers. The meeting will be held on Wednesday at the DoT office. Secretaries of both the DoT and IT ministry will chair the meeting.

306.title: 'Sign of weakness': NATO chief on Russian strikes across Ukraine
306.article_body: NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg on Tuesday said he believes that Russia's missile strikes on Ukrainian cities on Monday were a "sign of weakness" as Russian forces are unable "to make progress on the battlefield". "While Russia is increasingly resorting to horrific and indiscriminate attacks on civilians and critical infrastructure, President Putin is failing in Ukraine," Stoltenberg stated.

307.title: Condemn Russia's irresponsible nuclear rhetoric: G7 leaders at meet
307.article_body: The leaders of the Group of Seven (G7) nations have condemned Russia's "irresponsible nuclear rhetoric" and recent missile strikes on Ukraine. The leaders said the use of nuclear, chemical or biological weapons would invite "severe consequences". The G7 leaders on Tuesday held an emergency virtual meeting, which was attended by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

308.title: Suzlon Group gets 144.9 MW wind power order from Aditya Birla Group
308.article_body: Suzlon Group announced that it has secured an order for the development of 144.9 MW of wind power projects for Aditya Birla Group. Suzlon will install 69 units of wind turbine generators (wind turbines) with a Hybrid Lattice Tubular (HLT) tower and a rated capacity of 2.1 MW each. The project is located at sites in Gujarat and Madhya Pradesh.

309.title: Govt mulls 233 GW new transmission capacity for renewable energy
309.article_body: The Ministry of Power said the government is mulling electricity transmission for renewable energy capacity of about 233 GW, latest by 2030, across the country. The ministry told members of Parliamentary Consultative Committee, "Planning of transmission system for integration of additional 52 GW potential REZ (renewable energy zone) by 2026-27 have been carried out."

310.title: More than 1,300 fans banned from FIFA World Cup 2022 in Qatar by UK
310.article_body: More than 1,300 fans from England and Wales with banning orders won't be allowed to travel to Qatar for FIFA World Cup 2022, the UK's Home Office said. "We will not let the behaviour of a minority of lawbreakers tarnish what will be an exciting tournament," said Home Secretary Suella Braverman. The banned supporters have a history of soccer-related violence.

311.title: Lakshya Sen moves to career-best No. 8 in world badminton rankings
311.article_body: Commonwealth Games champion Lakshya Sen moved up to his career-best eighth position in the Badminton World Federation (BWF) men's singles rankings. The 21-year-old Sen was previously ranked at ninth position. Notably, the Almora-born shuttler started the year with a gold medal at the Yonex-Sunrise India Open 2022 and was also a runner-up at the All England Open Badminton Championships.

312.title: Voting for Congress is voting for BJP: Sisodia to Himachal voters
312.article_body: Senior Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Manish Sisodia on Tuesday told voters in poll-bound Himachal Pradesh that "voting for the Congress is equal to voting for the BJP". Legislators from Congress will join the BJP after the elections, claimed Sisodia. His comments came after BJP National President JP Nadda's speech earlier in the day in the state.

313.title: Digvijaya Singh asks Lalu Prasad Yadav to join Bharat Jodo Yatra
313.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh has asked RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav to join the ongoing Bharat Jodo Yatra as it will "send out a good message". Speaking at the RJD's national convention, Lalu asked all parties, including Congress, to come together against the BJP in the 2024 elections. He added that an Emergency-like dictatorial atmosphere prevails in India.

314.title: Ex-India head coach Kirsten joins Netherlands as consultant for T20 WC
314.article_body: Former India head coach Gary Kirsten has joined the Netherlands team as a consultant for the T20 World Cup. The team have also roped in Australian all-rounder Dan Christian into their backroom staff. Kirsten had worked with the team during their Super League series against Ireland last year and the team trained at Kirsten's Cape Town academy in September.

315.title: Govt ensured balanced, equitable development of every region: Himachal CM
315.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur on Tuesday said the BJP government ensured balanced and equitable development of every region of the state in the last five years. Thakur inaugurated and laid the foundation stone for 183 developmental projects worth ₹1,008.42 crore from Kullu for various Assembly constituencies. For Kangra district, he inaugurated 28 developmental projects worth ₹108.98 crore.

316.title: US has been participating de facto in Ukraine war: Russian Foreign Minister
316.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on Tuesday told state television that the Ukraine war was being "controlled by the Anglo-Saxons". "It seems to me that the Americans have been participating de facto in this war for a long time," said Lavrov. He also refuted White House national security spokesman John Kirby's claim that Russia had refused talks with the US.

317.title: Took us time to get used to conditions: Boucher on SA's series loss vs India
317.article_body: South Africa head coach Mark Boucher said some "soft dismissals" put his team under pressure in their seven-wicket loss against India in the third ODI in New Delhi. "It took us time to get used to conditions...India bowled really well with intent and aggression. We take from here some good lessons," he added. South Africa lost the three-match series 1-2.

318.title: BJP to contest all 60 seats in 2023 Meghalaya Assembly elections
318.article_body: The BJP has announced to field candidates in all the 60 seats in Meghalaya Assembly election, which is expected to be held in February 2023. Meghalaya BJP President Ernest Mawrie said people of the state are happy with the schemes implemented by the BJP-led central government. The BJP is an ally of the National People's Party-led coalition government in Meghalaya.

319.title: 17-yr-old boy arrested for 'marrying' 16-yr-old girl in Tamil Nadu
319.article_body: A 17-year-old boy has been arrested by Tamil Nadu Police in Cuddalore after a video of him 'marrying' a 16-year-old minor girl at a bus shelter went viral. The man who recorded the video of the public incident was also arrested by the police. The girl received counselling while the boy has been sent to a juvenile home.

320.title: 2 killed in explosion at illegal firecracker unit in West Bengal
320.article_body: Two persons including a teenage boy were killed and five others injured after an explosion at an illegal firecracker unit in West Bengal's East Midnapore. The owner of the house where the explosion took place had his firecracker manufacturing license lapse last year. A portion of the house's roof collapsed after the explosion in the room being used for storage.

321.title: Indian Railways' earning increases 92% YoY to ₹33,476 cr in FY23 till October
321.article_body: Indian Railways said that its total approximate earnings from April 1 to October 8, 2022, is ₹33,476 crore, registering a 92% increase on a year-on-year basis. In reserved passenger segment, the total approximate number of passengers booked during the period increased from 34.56 crore to 42.89 crore. Railways reported a revenue of ₹26,961 crore from reserved passenger segment.

322.title: I have spoken to Putin only once and that was about 18 months ago: Musk
322.article_body: Elon Musk on Tuesday tweeted, "I have spoken to Putin only once and that was about 18 months ago." He added, "The subject matter was space." Musk's tweet came after reports claimed that he directly spoke with Russian President Vladimir Putin before tweeting a proposal to end the war in Ukraine earlier this month.

323.title: Sourav Ganguly declines IPL Chairman post, to be out of BCCI: Report
323.article_body: Sourav Ganguly's tenure as BCCI President will come to an end next week when Roger Binny will replace him at the annual general meeting, the Indian Express reported. Ganguly was offered the post of IPL Chairman, however, he declined the offer, the report added. The BCCI won't back Ganguly for the post of ICC Chairman as well, the report stated.

324.title: Was told to fight Cong polls 18 hrs before filing nomination: Kharge
324.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said that he was told to contest for the post of the party's President 18 hours before he filed his nomination papers. "I am of the belief that the party needs Rahul Gandhi and his leadership," he added. Kharge said that Rahul Gandhi didn't want any Gandhi family member to be the Congress President.

325.title: Complete lie: Cong on claim of 'using' kids during Bharat Jodo Yatra
325.article_body: Congress dismissed child rights body NCPCR's allegation that the party violated the law by setting up 'Jawahar Bal Manch' and "using" children for political purposes during the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. NCPCR has lodged an official complaint with the Election Commission of India. Congress leader Jairam Ramesh called the allegation a "complete lie". Several children have been spotted at the yatra.

326.title: 34,000 people affected due to floods in 3 districts of Assam
326.article_body: Nearly 34,000 people, including 8,378 children, from three districts of Assam, namely Dhemaji, Lakhimpur and Dibrugarh, have been affected by floods. According to Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA), the water level of the Brahmaputra river is flowing above the danger level mark at Neamatighat in Jorhat. The flood waters have submerged 1,300 hectares of cropland in these districts.

327.title: New space bill completely different from the 2017 bill: ISpA
327.article_body: Director General of the Indian Space Association (ISpA) Lt Gen AK Bhatt said the new space bill is "completely different" from the bill proposed in 2017. According to the 2017 bill, any activity undertaken without prior licensing would attract a jail term. "That (previous bill) was a little harsh," Lt Gen Bhatt said.

328.title: Hrithik Shokeen creates history, becomes first-ever 'Impact Player' in Indian T20 cricket
328.article_body: Delhi off-spinner Hrithik Shokeen has created history by becoming the first-ever 'Impact Player' in Indian T20 cricket. The 22-year-old became the first tactical substitute under new rules after he replaced opener Hiten Dalal, who scored 47(27) in Delhi's Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy match on Tuesday. Shokeen registered figures of 3-0-13-2 as Delhi won by 71 runs.

329.title: Hosts India open their FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup campaign with 0-8 defeat against USA
329.article_body: Hosts India opened their FIFA Under-17 Women's World Cup campaign with a 0-8 defeat against USA in a Group A match in Bhubaneswar. It is USA's biggest-ever victory in the history of FIFA Under-17 Women's World Cup. USA scored five goals in the first half and the remaining three goals in the second half.

330.title: Video shows Rahul doing pushups on the road during Bharat Jodo Yatra in K'taka
330.article_body: Congress on Tuesday shared a video of Rahul Gandhi doing pushups on a road in Karnataka during the Bharat Jodo Yatra. Rahul was joined by Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar and the party's General Secretary KC Venugopal in taking the 'pushup challenge'. The party's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', which began on September 7, will conclude in Kashmir.

331.title: Kangana meets Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur, shares pics
331.article_body: Kangana Ranaut met Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur in Manali on Tuesday. She took to Instagram to share a series of pictures from the meeting. In a picture, Kangana was seen having breakfast with Thakur and others. "Mom specially made Himachali bhalles and babrus as breakfast for our CM, which he ate and really loved," she captioned the picture.

332.title: BJP alleges Congress leader among Maoists arrested in Chhattisgarh
332.article_body: The BJP's Chhattisgarh unit has alleged that a Congress leader from Bastar's Bijapur district was arrested by the Telangana Police along with four Maoists. "Satyam, who is a block Congress president, was also arrested by police. Satyam was close to a local Congress MLA," alleged former Forest Minister Mahesh Gagda. The Congress has denied Satyam's links to the party.

333.title: Honda Motor, LG to build $4.4 billion EV battery plant in US' Ohio
333.article_body: Honda Motor and LG Energy Solution on Tuesday said that they will build a new joint venture $4.4 billion plant to produce batteries for electric vehicles in US' Ohio. The companies had announced the plans for this last year, but had not revealed a location. The companies are planning to begin the construction of the new plant in early 2023.

334.title: J&K administration approves sale of beer in departmental stores
334.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir (J-K) administration has approved the sale of beer at departmental stores in urban centres. The decision was taken in a meeting of the J-K Administrative Council (AC), chaired by Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha. Accordingly, changes have been made to the Jammu and Kashmir Liquor Licence and Sale Rules, 1984 and Excise Policy, 2023-24.

335.title: Give details of criminal cases on MPs/MLAs: Supreme Court to HCs
335.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) has asked High Courts in the country to furnish details on criminal cases against lawmakers with a pendency of over five years. Justices Hima Kohli and DY Chandrachud said related affidavits must be filed in four weeks. The bench was hearing a PIL which sought a ban on convicted lawmakers from taking part in elections.

336.title: 1st solar observatory to solve mystery of Sun’s eruptions launched by China
336.article_body: China launched the Advanced Space-based Solar Observatory (ASO-S), nicknamed Kuafu-1, its first solar observatory on October 9. Kuafu-1 aims to unravel the mysteries of the Sun's eruptions. It will provide insights into how the Sun's magnetic field causes coronal mass ejections (CMEs) and other eruptions. It will also conduct simultaneous observations of both solar flares and CMEs.

337.title: Raj student arrested over false allegations of rape threats by classmate
337.article_body: An 18-year-old student in Rajasthan's Jodhpur was arrested and expelled from his school after his classmate falsely accused him of threatening her with rape and acid attack as he had become friends with another girl. Police grew suspicious after she continued to complain of threat letters even after the boy's arrest. She later confessed she had written the letters herself.

338.title: Finance Minister Sitharaman reaches US for IMF-World Bank meet
338.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman reached Washington DC on Tuesday to attend the annual meetings of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and the World Bank. She will meet US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen. Sitharaman is also likely to participate in bilateral meetings with several countries, including Japan, South Korea, Saudi Arabia, Australia, Bhutan and New Zealand.

339.title: Iran intensifies crackdown on protesters in its Kurdistan province
339.article_body: Iran on Tuesday intensified its crackdown on protesters in the country's western Kurdistan province, with reports of police firing in Sanandaj city. Female protesters in Iran are agitating against the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, who was allegedly assaulted by the police over an "improper hijab". The US and Amnesty International have criticised the violence against demonstrators.

340.title: Lack of all-rounders has been issue for India: Ex-England skipper
340.article_body: Former English skipper Nasser Hussain said that not having enough all-rounders has been an issue for the Indian cricket team. "At the start of T20...everyone talked about how there is no need to worry about No.7," Hussain said. He added, "But actually, if you have a solid No.7, then it means that your top six can absolutely go for it."

341.title: 12-yr-old sets himself on fire over reluctance to return to school
341.article_body: A 12-year-old boarding school student allegedly attempted self-immolation in Odisha's Jajpur district on Tuesday after his parents refused to let him extend his stay at home following Durga Puja holidays, police informed. The boy sustained severe burn injuries and is currently battling for his life, police added. The police said they were looking into the matter.

342.title: Demands for reservation rise in K'taka after SC/ST quota hike
342.article_body: After the Karnataka government increased the quota for SCs and STs, reservation-related demands from other communities have increased in the state. Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that while there are aspirations from all communities, decisions will only be taken after due consideration. "Naturally, everyone will have aspirations. We have taken up SC/ST communities first," Bommai said.

343.title: First look of Adam Driver as Enzo Ferrari in Michael Mann's 'Ferrari' out
343.article_body: The first look of Adam Driver as Italian motor racing driver and entrepreneur Enzo Ferrari for the upcoming biopic 'Ferrari' has been revealed. The Michael Mann directorial will also feature Shailene Woodley and Penélope Cruz, among others. Penélope will star as Enzo's wife Laura Ferrari and Shailene will play Enzo's mistress Lina Lardi. 'Ferrari' is expected to release in 2023.

344.title: Goa CM ate non-veg food before visiting temple: Congress leader
344.article_body: Congress leader Ramesh Kanchan claimed Goa CM Pramod Sawant ate non-vegetarian food during a lunch organised for him before visiting the Sri Krishna temple in Karnataka. The organiser refuted the claims and said the menu was restricted to vegetarian items only. MLA Raghupathi Bhat, who was with Sawant, said non-vegetarian food was only provided to the officials accompanying the CM.

345.title: He never aged for me, he's still the same: Balki on Big B's b'day
345.article_body: Filmmaker R Balki, speaking on Amitabh Bachchan's 80th birthday, said, "I always tell him, 'You're pretending to be 80, show me proof of your age...I don't believe you're 80'." "For me, he has never aged. He's still the same, will always be the same," Balki added. The duo have worked together in several films, including 'Cheeni Kum', 'Paa' and 'Shamitabh'.

346.title: Artist Sudarsan pays tribute to Mulayam Singh with sand sculpture
346.article_body: Sand artist Sudarsan Pattnaik created a sand sculpture at Puri beach in Odisha to pay tribute to late Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav on Monday. The sculpture had an impression of Yadav with engravings reading, "Tribute to Mulayam Singh Yadav. Om Shanti."
