Pattnaik, who was awarded the Padma Shri in 2014, shared a picture of the art on Twitter.

347.title: Kuldeep's form and year 2022 just keeps getting better: Irfan Pathan
347.article_body: Praising India spinner Kuldeep Yadav following his 4/18 in third ODI against South Africa, Irfan Pathan tweeted, "Kuldeep Yadav's form and year 2022 just keeps getting better. Good for Indian cricket." The 27-year-old was adjudged 'Player of the Match'. This is the first time since January 2019 that Kuldeep has taken four wickets in an ODI innings.

348.title: Felt my career was over after getting hypersexualised: Scarlett Johansson
348.article_body: Hollywood actress Scarlett Johansson revealed she became objectified in a way where she felt she wasn't getting offers for work that she wanted to do. "Everybody thought I was older...I'd been [acting] for a long time, I got...pigeonholed into this weird hypersexualised thing. I felt like [my career] was over," she added. Scarlett said it was scary at that time.

349.title: J&K is striding fast on path of development: MoS John Barla
349.article_body: Union Minister of State for Minority Affairs John Barla on Tuesday said that Jammu and Kashmir is striding fast on the path of development. "Various projects will be sanctioned in Ramban for welfare of minorities," Barla said. John Barla visited Ramban district as part of the Centre's third phase of the public outreach programme in Jammu and Kashmir.

350.title: Tripura being used for Myanmar-Bangladesh drug trade: CM Saha
350.article_body: Tripura CM Manik Saha said his state, along with Assam and Mizoram, is a corridor for Myanmar-based traffickers to send drugs to Bangladesh. He said the state has requested the Centre to strengthen BSF's presence and create an NCB unit in the state. He added that Amit Shah had warned that arms and ammunition might also be trafficked.

351.title: President Droupadi Murmu to visit Assam on October 13 & 14
351.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu will visit Assam on October 13 and 14, where she will take part in several government programmes. The President will also visit Kamakhya Temple on October 14. "The President...will inaugurate Dhubri Medical College and Hospital and will attend a civic programme to be held at Assam Administrative Staff College," Assam Tourism Minister Jayanta Malla Baruah said.

352.title: UP BJP MLA gets 2-year jail term in Muzaffarnagar riots case, granted bail later
352.article_body: A special court on Tuesday sentenced Uttar Pradesh BJP MLA Vikram Saini and 11 others to two years' imprisonment in the 2013 Muzaffarnagar riots case. They were taken into custody and later granted bail after they furnished two sureties for filing an appeal in the high court against their conviction. The court convicted them of rioting and other offences.

353.title: Iran's morality police once detained me, took me to 're-education centre': Elnaaz
353.article_body: Actress Elnaaz Norouzi, who recently expressed her support to anti-hijab protests in her native country Iran, revealed she had an encounter with the country's morality police. "I went to this 're-education centre'...They take your phone [and]...ID," she stated. Elnaaz added she was let go of in just one day because her family took help from their contacts on the inside.

354.title: India had 'very difficult' 2.5 years in its ties with China: S Jaishankar
354.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday said, "We had a two-and-a-half very difficult years in our relationship with China." He added, "It included the first bloodshed we've had on the border after 40 years and where we actually lost 20 soldiers." He also said, "But our endeavour, my endeavour has been to keep the communication lines going."

355.title: My last relationship taught me not to gift pets: Sidharth Malhotra
355.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra, during a rapid-fire round, revealed his last relationship taught him never to gift pets. Later, Sidharth said he'll steal Alia Bhatt's cat. The actor was rumoured to be dating Alia. During Sidharth's recent appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7', he was asked to name one thing he missed about her ex, to which, he replied her cat.

356.title: It was tough, didn't help scoring just 99: SA skipper Miller on 3rd ODI loss
356.article_body: South Africa skipper David Miller said the seven-wicket loss against India in third ODI at Arun Jaitley Stadium was "very tough". "Didn't help scoring just 99. Disappointing result today," he added. South Africa were bowled out for 99 in 27.1 overs after being put in to bat first. India scored 105/3 in 19.1 overs to win the three-match series 2-1.

357.title: Essential food items' prices soar in Tunisia amid economic crisis
357.article_body: Food prices in Tunisia have soared recently, giving rise to fears of an oncoming economic crisis. Vegetable oil, sugar, rice and even packaged water are in short supply. Tunisians are standing in long lines to procure these essential items which are now being rationed. The government has blamed hoarders, the war in Ukraine and speculative buying for the situation.

358.title: Oil prices fall amid fears of possible global recession
358.article_body: Oil prices reported a fall of nearly 2% on Tuesday amid fears of a possible global recession and concerns over global demand due to rising COVID-19 cases in China. Brent crude was down 1.7% to $94.56 per barrel, while US West Texas Intermediate crude dropped 2% to $89.31/barrel. Notably, IMF has cut the global growth outlook for 2023 to 2.7%.

359.title: What multiple records did India break in 3rd ODI against South Africa?
359.article_body: The 3rd ODI marked India's biggest win while chasing against South Africa in terms of balls remaining (185). India dismissed South Africa below 100 in an ODI for the first time. India also equalled the record for most wins in international cricket in a calendar year (38). India have now won the most number of ODI series (five) in 2022.

360.title: OTT will be a parallel industry to theatres: Actor Rajkummar Rao
360.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao has said that OTT platforms will be a parallel industry to theatres. Rajkummar stated that theatres and OTT platforms will beautifully co-exist as people love watching both films and web projects. "What the OTT platforms have done is that they've created...many opportunities for...many people who were not getting the kind of work that they deserve," Rajkummar added.

361.title: Apple may roll out 5G support for iPhone in India by Dec: Report
361.article_body: Apple may roll out 5G support for users of iPhone 12 and newer models in India by December this year, according to reports. Apple is reportedly extensively testing its 5G iPhone models on both Airtel and Reliance Jio's 5G networks. Senior executives from Apple and Airtel will also meet this week to discuss the rollout timeline.

362.title: Man dies while 'performing stunts' on moving train in Punjab
362.article_body: A man died while allegedly performing stunts on a moving train near Khanna in Punjab's Ludhiana district. The deceased's head hit a pole while hanging out of the door of the train coach, police said. The incident was captured in a 17-second video following which the Government Railway Police (GRP) was trying to identify the deceased.

363.title: Palestinian minor succumbs to gunshot wound from Israeli army raid
363.article_body: A 12-year-old Palestinian boy on Monday succumbed to gunshot wounds inflicted by Israeli soldiers during an army raid in September on a refugee camp in West Bank, Palestinian officials said. The Israeli army said it was aware of an allegation regarding injuries to a minor who participated in "violent riots". The circumstances surrounding the event are being examined, it added.

364.title: Box office has become more important than films: Shekhar Kapur
364.article_body: Filmmaker Shekhar Kapur took to Twitter and wrote that box office collections are becoming "far more important than the film itself". "Even for audiences," he added. "I can't ever remember looking at first week's box office collections of 'Masoom' or 'Mr India'. And over 30 years later, people are still watching these films," Shekhar further wrote.

365.title: Don't recall allowing RSS camps in govt schools: K'taka minister
365.article_body: Karnataka minister Kota Shrinivas Poojari said he does not remember giving RSS permission to run training camps in government schools. "We permitted other organisations for personality development programs. I don't think RSS even asked for permission," said Poojari. Earlier, a report claimed that a government body gave RSS permission to conduct camps in Kolar and Uttara Kannada districts.

366.title: Happy with my performance: Siraj on winning Player of the Series award
366.article_body: After Mohammed Siraj was named 'Player of the Series' against South Africa, the India pacer said, "Performing against a good team gives you a lot of confidence." He added, "I had to take responsibility. I try to figure out...right lengths at the start of the innings...Happy with my performance." Siraj took total five wickets in the three-match ODI series.

367.title: A true genius and prodigy: Raina to Hardik on his 29th birthday
367.article_body: Wishing India all-rounder Hardik Pandya on his 29th birthday, Suresh Raina took to Twitter and wrote, "Happy birthday to one of the finest players...a true genius and a prodigy to so many who aspire to become like you." Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "May you have an outstanding year ahead. Wish you [the] best of health, life and career."

368.title: Cong is 'sinking ship', people there will come to BJP: Karnataka CM
368.article_body: Karnataka CM and BJP leader Basavaraj Bommai called the Congress a "sinking ship" on Tuesday. He claimed that those who are in the Congress will come to BJP's side in a few days. Addressing a gathering in poll-bound Karnataka, Bommai said the BJP will place its report card before people and will return to power once again in the state.

369.title: Flood-hit Pakistan to buy 6 million mosquito nets from India: Report
369.article_body: As per a report, Pakistan's health ministry has approved the purchase of over six million mosquito nets from India amid the spread of vector-borne diseases in the country due to floods. The WHO is using financial resources provided by Global Fund to acquire the nets for Pakistan, the report added. Officials said malaria is spreading rapidly in 32 flood-affected districts.

370.title: Anytime a white-ball team like India turns up runs are on offer: Ish Sodhi
370.article_body: New Zealand spinner Ish Sodhi said he's looking forward to the bilateral series against India after the T20 World Cup. "New Zealand, I guess, is renowned for its small boundaries. Anytime a white-ball team like India turns up, I think there are always going to be runs on offer," he added. India-New Zealand will play three T20Is and three ODIs.

371.title: Alcohol comes out of hand pump in MP, police bust illicit liquor den
371.article_body: While raiding a hooch den in Madhya Pradesh's Guna district, police started pumping a hand pump and found alcohol coming out of it. After digging, they found tanks filled with illicit liquor buried about seven feet in the ground. Police said the traders extracted the liquor from the hand pump and sold it by filling it in polythene bags.

372.title: PM 'whitewashed real history': Cong on PM Modi's criticism of Nehru
372.article_body: Congress on Tuesday criticised PM Narendra Modi for his apparent dig at Jawaharlal Nehru on the Kashmir issue, alleging that he has once again "whitewashed real history" and overlooked facts to "castigate" India's first PM. PM on Monday said that Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel resolved issues related to the merger of princely states but "one person" couldn't solve the Kashmir issue.

373.title: Scientists map 'graveyard of stars' in our galaxy for the 1st time, pics released
373.article_body: Scientists from The University of Sydney have announced that a graveyard of ancient stars has been mapped in the Milky Way galaxy for the first time. The 'galactic underworld' stretches three times the height of the Milky Way, the researchers said. They have charted "the corpses of once massive suns that have since collapsed into black holes and neutron stars".

374.title: Shah Rukh Khan pens note on Big B's 80th b'day, calls him 'superhuman'
374.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan took to Twitter and wished Amitabh Bachchan on his 80th birthday. "One thing to learn from this great man, actor, superstar, father...superhuman is to never back away...instead learn...level up and launch again and again...forever," he tweeted. Along with the tweet, he shared a video with Amitabh where both sing 'Ek Doosre Se Karte Hain Pyaar Hum'.

375.title: Serious debt crisis unfolding across developing countries: UNDP
375.article_body: The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) has said that a serious debt crisis is now unfolding across developing economies. It further estimated that 54 countries are in need of immediate debt relief to avoid even more extreme poverty. "It is urgent...to step up and find ways in which we can deal with these issues before they become...unmanageable," it added.

376.title: TMC MLA Manik Bhattacharya sent to 14-day ED custody in SSC scam
376.article_body: TMC MLA Manik Bhattacharya was on Tuesday sent to 14-day ED custody in connection with the School Service Commission (SSC) scam case. He was arrested by the probe agency earlier in the day. The ED earlier arrested former state minister Partha Chatterjee and his close aide Arpita Mukherjee in this case.

377.title: India have played some timid cricket in ICC events: Nasser Hussain
377.article_body: Ex-England skipper Nasser Hussain said that India's issues have been ICC events. "They (India) have been going around beating everyone, with a variety of players," Hussain said. He added, "But the truth is that they have played some timid cricket in world events...They have got to keep the same mindset they have had in the bilateral events."

378.title: 2,000 left without power after Ukrainian strike: Russian official
378.article_body: The governor of Russia's Belgorod region on Tuesday said that more than 2,000 people had been left without power following Ukrainian shelling that hit an electricity substation in the town of Shebekino. The Russian town is located near the border with Ukraine's Kharkiv region. Governor Vyacheslav Gladkov said that emergency services were working to restore the power supply.

379.title: YouTube introduces account handles to allow users to tag each other
379.article_body: YouTube has introduced account handles to make it easier for users to interact and tag other users. Handles will appear on channel pages and Shorts so that they will be instantly and consistently recognisable. Handles can be used to tag users in comments or video titles. YouTube will inform users over next month when they can choose their channel's handle.

380.title: Gujarat's BJP govt deliberately kept Amreli district backward: AAP
380.article_body: AAP leader Raghav Chadha on Tuesday alleged that the BJP-led Gujarat government deliberately kept Amreli district backward. He said that there's a serious water problem in the district, adding that water comes once in three-four days at no fixed time. The population of Amreli is decreasing every year because people are migrating to other places.

381.title: 2 men sentenced to 20 years in prison for rape in Rajasthan
381.article_body: A special court in Rajasthan's Bundi sentenced two men to 20 years in prison for raping a 20-year-old woman with hearing and speech impairment in February 2020. The court also imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh on 24-year-old Lalaram Meena and 23-year-old Munesh Bairwa, public prosecutor Mahaveer Prasad Meghwal said. The statements of 15 witnesses were recorded, Meghwal said.

382.title: Credit Suisse may see $8 bn shortfall in 2024: Goldman Sachs
382.article_body: Goldman Sachs Group has said that Swiss lender Credit Suisse will face a capital shortfall of as much as $8 billion in 2024. Analysts have said that restructuring of Credit Suisse is required while capital generation is low. Further, they said, "Credit Suisse continues to face cyclical and structural challenges" and maintained sale recommendation of the stock.

383.title: Troll shares stats and calls Aakash Chopra 'failed cricketer', former cricketer responds
383.article_body: Reacting to a video of Aakash Chopra, a troll shared statistics and called Chopra a "failed cricketer". "What's this...How can you talk about cricket?" the troll tweeted. Aakash responded, "I googled you...found no career in cricket or otherwise...Going by your logic...how can you talk about me? When you a ________ person in life...On a serious note...Get a life...my friend...Love you."

384.title: Big B started calling me 'maalkin' during 'Waqt...' shoot: Shefali Shah
384.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah revealed that Amitabh Bachchan started calling her 'maalkin' while they were shooting for the 2005 film 'Waqt: The Race Against Time'. "I was giving [husband and film's director] Vipul Shah some gyaan...Amit ji was standing...he said, 'Should we keep the director or change him also' (laughs). So from then on, he calls me maalkin," she stated.

385.title: Wicket was perfect: Kuldeep on his 4/18 in India's win in 3rd ODI vs SA
385.article_body: After being adjudged 'Player of the Match' in India's seven wicket-win against South Africa in third ODI, spinner Kuldeep Yadav said the wicket was perfect at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. "I am enjoying my bowling. I am not thinking too much about the result, just focussing on the process and...on my rhythm," he added. Kuldeep posted bowling figures of 4.1-1-18-4.

386.title: Uber shuts down in 5 Pak cities, to continue services via Careem
386.article_body: Uber has said that it will discontinue its services in five Pakistani cities including Karachi and Islamabad. Multan, Faisalabad and Peshawar are the other cities where operations will be stopped. Uber said that drivers and riders can switch to Careem, the Dubai-based company it bought. Uber will continue its operations in Lahore, where it also plans on launching new products.

387.title: Those claiming to be JP's disciples abandoned his ideology: Amit Shah
387.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday criticised the ruling coalition in Bihar and said those who claim to be disciples of Jayaprakash Narayan have abandoned his ideology. Attending the 120th birth anniversary celebrations of the socialist leader in Bihar's Saran district, Shah said Loknayak Jayaprakash Narayan spent his whole life for the welfare of the landless, poor, downtrodden and backward.

388.title: PM Modi offers prayers at Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga in MP's Ujjain
388.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday offered prayers at the Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga temple in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain. PM Modi later inaugurated the first phase of the more than 900-metre-long Shri Mahakal Lok corridor. It is built as one of the largest such corridors in the country. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan and Governor Mangubhai Patel were also present there.

389.title: Gyanvapi case hearing on carbon dating of 'Shivling' adjourned to Oct 14
389.article_body: A court in Varanasi adjourned the hearing on a petition seeking carbon dating of the alleged 'Shivling' found in Gyanvapi Mosque to October 14. The plea was disputed by the Muslim side, which claimed the structure is a "fountain". Advocate Mumtaz Ahmed said if the object gets damaged during carbon dating, it would amount to defiance of Supreme Court's order.

390.title: Worst is yet to come, 2023 will feel like a recession: IMF
390.article_body: The International Monetary Fund's (IMF) chief economist Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas on Tuesday said, "The worst is yet to come, and for many people, 2023 will feel like a recession." He added, "The US, China and the euro area will continue to stall." The IMF cut the global growth outlook for 2023 to 2.7%, down from the 2.9% estimated in July.

391.title: Malaysia's 97-yr-old ex-PM Mahathir to run in general elections
391.article_body: Malaysia's 97-year-old former PM Mahathir Mohamad on Tuesday announced that he will contest the general elections expected next month, in a bid to defend his parliamentary seat. "We haven't decided on who will be PM as it is only relevant if we win," he said. Mahathir has served as Malaysia's PM for a total of 24 years, in two terms.

392.title: NASA’s Dragonfly to land on dunes & shattered ice on Saturn’s moon in 2034
392.article_body: NASA's Dragonfly rotorcraft is scheduled to land on the Selk Crater region of Saturn's moon Titan in 2034. The region is a patchwork of sand dunes and broken-up ice. "Dragonfly will land in an equatorial, dry region of Titan, a frigid, thick-atmosphere, hydrocarbon world. It rains liquid methane sometimes, but it's more like a desert on Earth," a researcher said.

393.title: Shweta Bachchan shares unseen pics of Amitabh Bachchan on his 80th birthday
393.article_body: On the occasion of actor Amitabh Bachchan's 80th birthday, his daughter Shweta Bachchan shared some unseen pictures on Instagram. One of the pictures shows Shweta during her childhood as Amitabh holds her hand, while another photo shows Amitabh during his childhood days. One of them also shows Amitabh reading a holy scripture during a puja ceremony.

394.title: Raveena shares childhood pic with Amitabh on his b'day, pens note
394.article_body: Raveena Tandon took to Instagram on Tuesday to wish Amitabh Bachchan on his birthday. She shared an old picture where she could be seen sitting on her father's lap, who was seated next to Amitabh at an event. "Wishing you health, happiness...Will always be in awe, since then to now, no one was, or will ever be you," Raveena wrote.

395.title: I didn't know what Oscars were: 'Chhello Show' actor Bhavin Rabari
395.article_body: 'Chhello Show' actor Bhavin Rabari revealed he didn't know what the Oscars were. "I was told, 'The film has been selected for the Oscars'. That's when I came to know what the Oscars are," he added. Bhavin stated he didn't even like movies much, however, he has started liking them "little little". "Watching films is rare for us," Bhavin added.

396.title: Ola, Uber, Rapido need separate licence to run autos in K'taka: State govt
396.article_body: The Karnataka Transport Department on Tuesday directed cab and bike aggregators Ola, Uber and Rapido to apply for a separate license to run three-wheeler auto-rickshaws on their respective platforms. Transport Commissioner THM Kumar stated that companies are asked to stop plying auto services from Wednesday. Companies violating the order will be charged a fine of ₹5,000 per vehicle per day.

397.title: They are very smart & bright: Katrina on co-stars Siddhant, Ishaan
397.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif in an interview shared her experience of working with Ishaan Khatter and Siddhant Chaturvedi in the upcoming horror-comedy film 'Phone Bhoot'. She said that both the actors are "very smart" and "very bright", adding that they are good at improvisation. "For me, that was something required in a film like this," Katrina said.

398.title: 16 Dalits, including pregnant woman, kept locked up & tortured by man in K'taka
398.article_body: Sixteen people belonging to the Schedule Castes were allegedly kept locked up and tortured at a coffee plantation in Karnataka's Chikkamagaluru for 15 days, officials said. The accused, a BJP supporter named Jagadeesha Gowda, allegedly tortured a two-month-pregnant woman who lost her baby due to the assault, police said. Jagadeesha and his son Tilak Gowda are on the run.

399.title: It's a tough one: Steyn on Bumrah's replacement for T20 WC squad
399.article_body: Ex-South African bowler Dale Steyn said that to name a replacement for injured pacer Jasprit Bumrah in India's T20 World Cup squad is a "tough one". "Whoever gets selected, you probably want them to raise their game by a small percentage because of the hole that they are filling. It's so difficult to fill his (Bumrah) place," Steyn said.

400.title: Proud of the boys, the way they played: Dhawan on India's 2-1 ODIs win vs SA
400.article_body: Following India's 2-1 ODI series win against South Africa, India captain Shikhar Dhawan said he's proud of the team and the way they played showing maturity and carried the responsibility in the three-match series. "The boys showed great character on such tough batting pitches...bowlers were clinical today," he added. India defeated South Africa by seven wickets in third ODI.
